reviewTitle: Big Step Up From My Last Kindle_NOT
reviewDescription: Update 2 (May 8, 2024).With my old Kindle I could remove contents from my device without permanently deleting the items from my account.  With this new Kindle I don’t have that option.  I also downloaded a magazine just out of curiosity to see how it would appear on Kindle and now I can’t delete it and it appears new issues are automatically added to your homepage for you to download and be stuck with them.  I have to say, my initial enthusiasm for this new Kindle and the one feature, beside the obvious, reading, of it that I do like (the touch screen) has seriously dwindled.  I love reading on this Kindle, but I hate how completely user unfriendly it is in not allowing you to declutter your homepage without permanently deleting contents you want to keep and forcing your to keep content that you want to delete permanently and even adding the latest issue of that content to your homepage, where it stays permanently if your download it.  Another star lost.Update 2024/02/20I had to return and request a replacement because the entire week after delivery, I had to recharge it every night; and the night before I requested a replacement, the battery completely drained while it was in sleep mode.  The replacement’s battery life is no more than 48 before I get a low battery warning.  This is a far cry from the supposed six week battery life described on the product page.  I know the battery life is dependent on frequency of use, but with my old Kindle, which is well over 10 years old, when I went on a reading binge, reading almost to 24/7, I could go 2 weeks before the battery went down to 50%.  Everything I said in my original review still holds, but I think the front light really drains the battery life.  I could do without the front light, if it means a longer battery life and just get a reading lamp to clip to the case cover or my headboard when reading in low lighting/at night in bed.  My original rating was 5 stars, but I had to take away 2 stars for the battery like.  Other than the battery life, I really like this Kindle and won’t be returning it because it’s preferable to my phone or tablet.My last Kindle was purchased over 10 years ago and during that time it developed a glitch that made it not usable, so I decided to download the app instead of buying a new one since I was just reading when the latest installment of favorite authors/series came out. But I started reading more about three months ago when I decided to deactivate my social media accts. and decided to decrease my screen time with other apps.  Reading on my iPad was fine but was becoming cumbersome, so I decided to purchase a new Kindle.  I have to say there have been vast improvements in the over ten years since my last Kindle purchase and I have to say I love them all, especially the touch screen and front light.  Set-up was quite easy using the Kindle app and took less than 5 minutes.  This Kindle functions pretty much the way the app does.  The only thing I don’t like about it is way it briefly goes from light to dark or vice versa, if you’re in dark mode, when you turn the page.  I also wish it had the “page turn animation” feature like the app.  I got it today and have been reading all evening on and off and I have to say I’m pretty happy with it.

reviewTitle: Loved this Kindle but it "died" within 4 months
reviewDescription: I've had Kindles ever since the first one came out. I don't like reading books on my iPad. I read a lot and don't like accumulating hardback books. Kindles are perfect for me. I've upgraded my devices every few years. Although it's not considered an upgrade, this model was my favorite of all:  loved the size, the weight, the screen (very easy to read), the battery life. Loved everything about it. What's bad is that it "died" within 4 months of getting it.I never had a problem with all my other Kindles. I hope the problem is not a design flaw and that it will last as long as my others. If it doesn't "die" I strongly recommend this model.It was disappointing when it "died" and I have explained what happened at the end of this review. It's probably too much detail but it is what it is.I was in the middle of a book when it "died", so first, I ordered another one just like this one (reduced from $100 to $75) because I didn't want to wait the time it would take, once I found the right person to speak with at Amazon, for them to either fix this broken one or for them to send me a new one after mailing it back to them.I called Amazons Kindle help line to get an answer to this problem. They were great to work with and are crediting the purchase, and I am mailing the broken one back. I am satisfied with how the issue was resolved. The order I placed for a new one, and paid for, will be delivered tomorrow.Exactly what went wrong:The problem started when I couldn't find it - I left it (the new blue one) on the treadmill on the 2nd floor. Because I couldn't find it, I got an old black Kindle out, charged it, downloaded the book I was reading, and was finishing the book when my husband found the blue Kindle on the treadmill. I turned the blue one on - no problem - and began scrolling to the page where I left off on the old black one. Then everything on the screen went black. The green light was still on, but when I pressed the on-off button, the green light stayed on for only 2 seconds and the screen remained black. I plugged it in thinking it needed a charge. When plugged in, after about 10 minutes, the "sleep" screen came on. I unplugged it, pushed the on-off button, and the screen went black. I pressed the on-off button again and the green light was on for about 2 seconds. The screen remained black. I went through this process numerous times: sleep screen came on after about 5 or 10 minutes when it was left alone or plugged in, the green light remained on during this time, when I pressed the on-off button the screen turned black again. Every time I pressed the on-off button, the green light would go off in 2 seconds. I kept going through this process numerous times and the result was the same. That's when I ordered a new one and decided to figure out how and who to contact at Amazon the next day.Again, I never had a problem with all the other Kindles. This is my favorite for the reasons I have already mentioned. I hope the problem is not a design flaw and that it will last as long as my others. If it doesn't "die" again, I strongly recommend this model.

reviewTitle: I hate it/size, larger than Galaxy S23 ultra smaller than tablet, no physical page turn/buttons
reviewDescription: Size is awkward and hard to hold to use for reading having had a 2nd Gen kindle the turn page buttons and size was much more reasonable, this just feels cheap and likely to break much easier and I couldn't get the return item to come up or work when deciding I was just going to get the larger more expensive one so I could actually see it and not have to have the screen need 6 pages plus for a std page in the physical book, esp if you want to use it on the beach or relaxing rather then always having to hold the awkward size and constantly turn pages.  A little upset about trying to return it when I had a chance and not being able to, then the 30 days passing as I had just opened it and set it up shortly before the 30 days since I ordered it for the sale price, but wouldn't pay $50 for it even.  This is my personal preference and may not be an issue for others or those that read occasionally.  Also rarely if ever returned an item to amazon and bought the gen 2 kindle as I thought I'd use one over all the tech books and business books I would read, but had best buy GC's to use b4 expiring and ordered it, but sat in the box after setting it up, for years then finally getting time to use it 2 years ago had the screen go partially out on it and couldn't see the bottom half to get some books and media off it or connect to the new wifi from prior ISP's settings on it, even with physical keyboard and shipped it back for a discount, which seems to have disappeared on the 15 bucks off book purchases that I had seen when looking to order a book, but saw it was preorder or something not on kindle yet, then when looking at other books to use it on, the discount wasn't ava.  might be a fine print thing or issue with the return getting to them, not sure as tracking didn't work and the model wouldn't come up as something I had even though it was registered to my account, real big pain in the ... and time to try and figure it out that the risk to my BP if it resolves nothing isn't worth it and it'll just sit around useless now, but wish some returns were easier then having to print labels when i thought trees needed saving, recall paper or plastic?  yet everywhere went petro chemicals or the old PITA spokes persons who drove luxury cars?  Before bespoke was a buzzword, last I checked the only non leather luxury car was a terrible C class mercedes that was their cheapest model/package the rest come with friggin leather seats (cows) let along private jets for the signer that comes to mind.  Your call on if the size and design fits your suitability, but know it is also harder to highlight and such on, since you lose screen real-estate for the keyboard, buttons and other tools on the screen now as well.

This is one of the worst products I have ever purchased on Amazon (I buy a LOT - the Amazon kids tablet was even worse, though). My grandson likes playing on my phone, so I bought this to read on while he's on the phone. First, to "sync" to my phone and do a quick setup, I had to upgrade the Kindle app on my phone. Which then got rid of my ability to purchase books on my phone due to "play store rules". Horribly inconvenient and on top of it, the sync never worked (after trying for over 30 minutes). I finally just did the setup myself.Now I can buy books on this device, so if I'm reading on my phone, I have to open this device, hope it syncs to the last page, do the buy on the kindle. BUT then if I want to continue reading on the kindle, I have to X out of that screen, go back to the last book, reopen the store, and hope it lets me read the book. It has never once just let me click the read now button and go forward.I will say most of the time opening a book on one device and then the other, it syncs to the latest page read, which is fantastic!! Sometimes it doesn't and it's a massive pain to find the right page. And the kindle will give you the option to jump forward, but then the same screen stays up and gives you the option to jump back where you were. Took me a minute to realize what was happening, but now I know!Clicking pages forward or backwards is hit or miss - sometimes it goes forward when I tap on the right, sometimes back, sometimes it skips 3 or 4 pages. Sometimes it works ok, but OMG is it a frustrating device. I was reading on a Nook in 2010 that worked better than this!!  The technology has been there for over a decade, why is this so crappy? And the nook was cheaper than this thing is!! I switched to kindle for the free book subscription.I paid the extra for the no ads, which supposedly puts the cover of the book you're reading on the lock screen. Nope, it just puts random designs, but they stay there between books and just randomly change. They are never the cover of the book I'm reading, which is absolutely fine, but don't lie about what we're buying.This is extremely light weight, almost disconcertingly so, which is a plus. I had to stop reading paper due to the pain in my hands. It doesn't fit much on a page for my aging eyes (I'm only in my 40s but losing my near sightedness). I was expecting more to a page than on my phone, but it's really about the same size just wider and shorter. Battery life is ok - I've had about 3 weeks and already had to charge it once and it's at 30% again. I read for max 2 hours a day on this device and the rest of the time on the phone.So, overall, it does what I bought it for, badly, but it does it. I do NOT recommend this product, especially for the price. I'm a little shocked at how poorly Amazon produced this product.

reviewTitle: A buggy and poor user interface.
reviewDescription: The most comfortable way to hold this thing is have the the larger bezel on the right, so you can hold it and turn the page with your thumb, but somehow the designers of this device didn't test for that. You can turn the text so it is sideways, but the orientation is upside down, such that the large bezel on the left side, meaning if you want to advance the page, you have to reach all the way across the screen, or use your other hand. A software update could easily add or flip the orientation, but I'm not holding my breath.The touchscreen is just not good. There are a myriad of different touches that lead to highlighting, selecting, page turning, etc., and it's not explained well anywhere.Are a couple of page-turn buttons too much to ask for? Is that what we're supposed to pay an extra $100 for? Buttons? Modern technology is overrun with bad touchscreens and in many applications, like this one, buttons would do the job much better.You can't download the dictionary or translation features for offline usage.Besides the lack of buttons, the hardware isn't bad for the price. I just wish Amazon, with its infinite resources, put time and money into user testing and thoughtful software design. Especially because it basically has a monopoly on the market for eReaders.p.s. There's a bug in the translation feature, which comes from the fact that it detects language every time. It tries to translate English to English about 30% of the time, and another 20% it just says 'Unknown...try again.' There won't be that many languages going in one book, and it makes more sense to just let the user download a language and always translate that. Or, have it remember the previous language set.

I ordered the Kindle 6" with high res display in 2022. I had it replaced because cracks developed along the back corner while using the amazon version case/cover in less than a year. The kindle barely gets used (3-4 times per month) and sits in a desk drawer. It has never been dropped. Same went for the replacement that I recently noticed cracks on that is out of warranty. This Kindle is a poor design. It was my favorite version of the kindle given the high-res screen and compact form factor with minimal glare. My favorite kindle to date... so 2/5 stars... it looses three stars due to the limited life expectancy and poor design given the choice of brittle/thin plastic.

reviewTitle: Slow Interface, Fast Battery Drain, Horrible Content Management
reviewDescription: I'm not sure why people like this. This is my third Kindle, and I'm just disappointed.- The interface is slow, frequently unresponsive, and has no ability to accurately display content you "send to kindle".- Amazon locks down kindle content, just like apple does with their "ecosystem", which is just another word for "content trap".- Managing your content is not good. My wife's content constantly shows up in my device, despite me trying filtering it out in every conceivable way. I'm a tech person. I know exactly how it should work, and I've taken every step, but it still shows content I don't want to see.- With Wi-fi on, expect to have your device dead in a week or less. You basically have to have it in airplane move for it to make sense.I know everyone says to not read on an android or iphone, but the experience is much better overall.At the very least get a reader that doesn't lock you into an ecosystem.

reviewTitle: DO NOT EVER LET THE BATTERY COMPLETELY DISCHARGE - it becomes a BRICK
reviewDescription: I've had kindles in the past, and other e-readers, including cheap ones I got over a decade ago that go months / years sometimes without being charged and will STILL take a charge.  I was using the Kindle app on my phone quite a bit so I didn't use my Kindle for several weeks, possibly 6 weeks or so.  Now the Kindle I bought on Dec 22, 2022 WILL NOT CHARGE no matter how long I leave it charging.Very disappointed with this as now I realize it's quite common for Kindles to stop charging if the battery is completely drained. I'm seriously thinking about just not even replacing this one now.

reviewTitle: Screen control sensitivity and wake-up are problematic.
reviewDescription: Screen control sensitivity and wake-up are problematic: I use both a Kindle 11th. Gen (2022 release) purchased 2023 and Kindle Voyage purchased 2015.  I enjoy both and appreciate the lighter weight of the Kindle 11th. Gen. There are two serious issues though. First, on both models the screen swipe control and sensitivity seem wrong somehow. They are not always responsive. Both models have the very annoying characteristic of unexpectedly jumping numerous pages ahead. Then I must swipe back (this sometimes goes forward instead of backward) until I can find where I left off reading. A second very annoying issue on both models is the inability to wake the screen by touch or pressing a button. The only way is to fully close and reopen the cover (which is a little more involved with an Origami shell cover, which I highly recommend for holding the device for long periods of reading). The side controls (page-press sensors) on the Voyage no longer function. Regarding a third issue, on each I find the power cable port on the bottom to be an interference when holding the device or using a stand (I would prefer it on the top). In comparison, except for the lighter weight, I see no real differences in screen, function, or software (i.e., meaningful improvements) in 8 years. Better touch controls and a wake button (or screen spot) would be a wonderful set of improvements to the Kindle 11th. Gen.

reviewTitle: Serviceable but it's lacking important features.
reviewDescription: Pros: I like how light-weight it is. I like how much data storage is has. I like that I can put the screen on dark mode. I like that I can change the font size, font face, line spacing, and alignment. I like that I can press and hold on a word and it'll pull up a small window with the definition of that word.Cons: I don't like that I can't rotate the screen 180° so I can read it in landscape mode while it's properly placed in the case I bought to hold it up so I could read it in landscape mode. I don't like how the Kindle store works on this kindle. Also, this kindle has frozen while I was trying to borrow a book on the Amazon website. Had to Google how to reboot it.This is my first e-reader, and it's been a struggle. If I knew all these cons before I bought it, I would've bought a different brand of e-reader.

The kindle itself works nicely. It's easy to use, and I had no problem getting used to it. The design is comfortable and sleek.The problem arises when I find out I've been cheated out of $30 because the case that Amazon selects in the "accessory" tab isn't compatible with the device I bought. I bought an 11th gen kindle, and despite being on the page for said 11th gen kindle, the case that they list for it is for a 10th gen kindle. This means that the case does not provide a snug fit for the device, rather it's something of a large bulky shell that the kindle rattles around inside.It's actually a detriment to have the case on the device for any purpose other than security, as the kindle is far more likely to fall out. Somehow, it doesn't slide out of either crevice positioned at the top and bottom of the case, so lucky me.I don't think I can get a refund on the case without refunding the entire order (which includes the kindle), so they got me. Thanks. I suppose I'll have to buy a new case and hope I don't get cheated again.

reviewTitle: I like my Amazon Kindle Touch D01200 (4th Generation) better.
reviewDescription: I have an old (2011) Kindle Touch D01200 (4th Generation)-see photo. But I botched the battery change, and needed a replacement.  AMAZON says this item is not currently in stock and does not seem to plan to restock.so I bought this reader.I am sure many people will like this new Kindle just fine and it has many small improvements (lighted reading panel, less battery drain and great Bluetooth features and smaller pocket size) . BUT it no longer supports MP3 audio files, forget listening to music or tutorials, It also has no easy way to unhook wireless, it besieges you with incessant advertising of books it wants you to buy. Even if you search your library for a book or paper, most of the hints seem to come for books it wants to sell you. This is maddening. Also you can no longer get a list of your library, what you get is a picture of the book with the info,  but you get less books per page.  If you have a PDF collection of theses and term papers it is very annoying.For those without a reader this should be fine. For those used to the older 4th generation, you may want to shop for a used one (available on line for $20-$40) as I did. Hopefully Amazon makes 4th generation available again in the future.

Size, weight, and other aspects are fine. Easy transfer of data from my old Kindle to this new one. But there was no power cord and no recommendation of which to buy. Was surprised it came WITHOUT a cord and charger and the first I order doesn't fit. I'm leaving on a three-week trip in a few days with Kindle at only 25% power. Am returning this cord and charger and hoping the next one comes in time and actually fits. (Not made better since my old Kindle worked fine EXCEPT for a clunky power cord port. Got a new charger and cord for that which worked one week before the port finally died.)

This is actually my third Kindle, but my first Paper White. I’m an AVID reader. Like, finishing 2 books a week minimum. But I’ve noticed that between working at a computer 8+ hours a day, then reading a screen another 2 or 3 hours, is really taking a toll on my eyes. I had the Kindle Fire before, but I mostly read on the Kindle app on my phone since the Fire was bulky and didn’t fit in my hand or purse as well. This seemed the best of both worlds!Pros:•It’s SUPER light. Weights about the same, if not less than my iPhone.•Also, I loved how easy it was to set up! In less than 5 minutes I had access to my library and was able to pick up exactly where I left off with my book on my phone.•It’s size makes it easy to hold with one hand!Cons:•It doesn’t come with the charger. The cord, yes. But the adapter to plug into the wall? That’s another $20. I have a few laying around, but I don’t know what Watt they are, one mentions amps but not list a W. I don’t want to mess things up if they aren’t 9W so looks like I’m buying another adapter.•I’m embarrassed to say, I had to watch a YouTube video on my phone to figure out out to get back to the Home Screen. I don’t know if I missed the prompt or what, but I was getting frustrated trying to figure it out.•I was spoiled with the settings in the app as well. If this Kindle has Continuously Scrolling, I have yet to find the settings for it. I REALLY miss that. Especially when I try to hold it with one hand. I can only use my right hand because my left isn’t big enough to tap and changes pages on the right side of the screen. With Continuous Scrolling, it didn’t matter what side I used.•The screen occasionally flashes between Dark and Light mode when changing pages. It’s not all the time, and happens quickly. But it is jarring.•And this one is a bit silly, because the Paper White is just black and white. I knew this when buying. But I miss the “warmer” page color. The one that almost a soft yellow. More like the actual pages of a book. This is printer paper, pure white. When adjusting the brightness, it doesn’t adjust the contrast, which I know, the setting is literally how bright the screen is. I just like the difference between black and white to be a bit softer like that of an actual book.That’s all! Just me being super picky!! I do love this Kindle and will continue to use it. It’s just taking a bit of a learning curve for me.

reviewTitle: poor paging - tends to get annoying
reviewDescription: Paging is accomplished by swiping or touching the side of the screen.  It commonly jumps forward quite a few pages and then will only go back 1 or 2 so get stuck.  I've been making sure I don't have my finger hovering at the edge of the screen, thinking it is that.  I may be 20% into a book and page forward and it goes to the end.  Have to close and then reopen and it does take me to where I was.  This replaced am older kindle (7 years old or so) so I have used a kindle before.

reviewTitle: The Human Interface to this Kindle is Not Intuitive
reviewDescription: While the physical design of this Kindle is very good and it's quite readable, I believe the access to the book, navigating it, etc. isn't at all obvious. To make it worse, there was no included User Guide that I could find. So I had to buy one for an added charge.  It wasn't great either, but I was able to get to the point of having a usable Kindle after a few hours of reading this guide. Amazon could definitely do a better job with the Human Interface, especially given their long history with Kindle designs!

This is my third Kindle device. Frankly, I love it EXCEPT!The last two devices have an extremely irritating habit of randomly advancing anywhere from two to about ten pages with a page turn finger-swipe. It completely knocks one out of the rhythm of the subject being read. I have tried restarts, the software is kept updated - but it still occurs way too often and irritates the “H” out of me.If this isn’t resolved I won’t be replacing this one with a Kindle device. There’s no excuse for that aspect of the experience not being reliable.

I've had this kindle since February of 2023. It has been pretty good but it has always had a problem where it drops it spot in the book. and then when you try to go back to Page/Location it wont go to the right place.In the last 2 months(I've been reading more because of surgery) it has become unbearable. Looses its place like 10-15 times in an hour reading. I'm so frustrated I'm ready to throw it. This is my 3-4 kindle and have never had this problem with ANY of the others. SomeOne PLEASE HELP!!!!!!!!

Screen feels a little too small, if it were about 20% bigger it would really be ideal, but at least the e-Ink technology is pretty cool. It feels like I'm looking at a picture in a frame rather than a powered screen, at least when the brightness is turned down. One issue is that with some documents (most PDFs) the text is a bit too small to be comfortable and if I try to zoom in the tiny bit that I need, it instead zooms in a lot in one operation so that the text is clipped off on each side, rather inconvenient.Rather inconvenient describes the whole OS experience pretty well. You need special apps or e-mail operations to load most content even when it's a type that is supported, and this process can create duplicates in your library that are rather laborious to remove. On the Kindle you have to tap to open the option for each document and choose to delete and confirm, there's no batch operation and each operation is fairly laggy. The external apps let you handle multiple documents at once, but these changes will not be reflected on the device. I added a bundle of novels I bought from another site to my device and the first time about 20% of them were duplicated in my library, the second time (after resetting my device and letting my content add itself again on its own) about 95% of the novels now have duplicate entries, so if I want my library to be tidy I need to manually tap through and remove 30 different novels.Also while it is listed as supporting jpeg and gif, going through a gallery of jpegs is very inconvenient (you have to tap to open each one, then tap twice to close out and pick the next one), and gifs only function as a single non animate image.Further, there does not appear to be any OS alternatives for this device at this time. It seems people have been sufficiently discouraged or blocked from providing any alternative operations or applications for this device, as none of these processes support firmware that is as new as my Kindle shipped with. It's unfortunate since there's a lot more one could do with this device, but as far as I can tell with this model you're really locked in with what you get, and what you get is not great.

reviewTitle: Stops Working after a couple months
reviewDescription: Loved the Kindle at first and was able to easily download a few books to read. Within 3 months, the screen started glitching and the touch screen no longer works. It's a shame because I used it with a case and kept it by my nightstand the full time I have had it. Would love to get this product replaced because clearly it's just a faulty one.

reviewTitle: Came with a battery that did not charge.
reviewDescription: This came with a battery that did not charge from the very first use.An update:An Amazon employee called me after seeing the review and offered to assist me with the return process for a free replacement.  I was very impressed with this customer service. Although not worth the return given the price, I bought a used version stated to be in very good condition, I added a star for that appreciated follow-up by Amazon.

The kindle was marketed as 6 inches which led me to think that the screen would be 6 inches but the screen did not take up the entire surface. I didn't keep it for long so I cannot speak on functionality.

reviewTitle: Too lightweight and flimsy feeling, impractical bezels!
reviewDescription: The screen is a delight on this new Kindle, and it was the only thing that made me slightly regretful about sending it back. At 300 dpi it’s nice and sharp. It also has the ability to reverse black and white if you like that. And I love a recessed screen on an ereader… it seems like it’s even more glare-free than the waterproof version.BUT the cons far outweighed the pros for me. This Kindle is so lightweight that it feels like it might fly out of your hand at the least movement. The back isn’t grippy at all, making the problem worse. I realize now that an ereader needs to have just a *little* bit of heft to it so that it stays put in your hand.And the newly reduced bezels are now so tiny that my thumbs could never really find a comfortable spot to rest, meaning I was constantly fidgeting. I couldn’t settle into reading (as I do on my older Paperwhite) because I simply couldn’t get comfortable.My solution… return this Kindle, and go for an older refurbished Paperwhite. The ideal ereader for me!

reviewTitle: New User Interface is a disaster
reviewDescription: Note to Amazon developers:  An e-reader is not a phone!  An e-reader is not a tablet!  E-ink is not an LED!The new user interface is a disaster from my perspective.  The list view of books now shows a pointless and almost illegible picture of the book cover.  The picture takes up space and there are only four books shown on the screen.  I called Amazon and there is no way to turn this off. The list view is now one long page instead of being multiple pages as it was before.  There's a scroll bar now to move through the list, but it doesn't really work.  The response of e-ink is slow so you can't see where you are while you're scrolling.  There's no option to go ahead one screen.  So finding a specific place or scrolling through the list without missing anything is next to impossible.  There is a search bar, but it's less convenient than old way., This interface reminds me of the first Kindles which also made having many books difficult.  I returned it and bought new previous generation Paperwhite with 6" screen on Ebay since this new Kindle is Amazon's only 6" option.

All in all I like the Kindle. But the fact that only a very specific USBC amp-age works is extremely frustrating. It need a charge every 2 months or so with my reading rate. Which is just long enough to lose there charging block. Literally not a single other USBC thing will work. I’m about to order a block the third time 🙄

It is light weight. Easy to carry.  Very difficult to navigate the menu. It is so laggy.  I wanted to love this. Worse kindle ever purchased. Hate the shades of grey backgrounds and texts. Wish it was crisp black and white.  No color at all to the covers of the books. Instead of improving a product it appears they downgraded it.  And really mad I paid 99. And it is now 20. Cheaper 3 weeks later!  If I had not misplaced the box I would return it. The battery life they brag about is based on 30 minute reading a day and not using blue tooth or WiFi. I find I am charging it every other day. In three weeks time have charged over 15 times!  So very hard to find your book you bought. And tried going on the web and it never would load. Gonna stick with kindle fire. So much more for less.
Not good for aging eyes. There is no way to change font.
I didn’t like the 6” screen. Too small for reading.
Worst Kindle ever. So hard to maneuver. It's dumb luck that I can find my library. The result. I rarely use it. Sorry to all you writers out there.

reviewTitle: I expected better from a guy who builds rocket ships.
reviewDescription: Pros:-Lightweight-Customer service is awesome. So awesome that after I posted my first review (this is my second) Amazon called me within 20 minutes of clicking send.-Super long battery life.Cons.-Painfully slow and underpowered by todays standards.-Too short. This unit should have the same proportions as a paperback. The screen should be at least 6×8.-Not enough memory. 32 gigs would be better if you store work related manuals and text references on it.-No speaker. It needs at least one speaker, and page turning sound effects, to fully give you the book reading experience of autonomous sensory meridian response you get with reading physical books.-The device is only worth about $35 as is. It's akin to something you'd buy from Radio Shack.-Consider downloading the Kindle app to your phone or tablet for color illustrations and a better reading experience.
I have large hands so it is hard to handle.  It is very small.  I am always turning pages.

I bought this to stop using my iPad mini for books after I almost dropped it into the hot tub.  I can’t  believe that after all these years that the Kindle OS is still beset with flickering and flashing redraws and the obnoxious hidden touch-insensitive modal controls as my older (8-9 years?) original KindleWhite.  Yeah, it's got more DPI, more storage, and USB-C  (all that saves this from one star) but that doesn't make me care if I drop this Kindle in the hot tub.If I hadn't trashed the packing materials into a dirty trashcan I'd return this sucker.

The issue I have is the slippery case of this version, unlike the textured, possibly rubberized casing of previous versions.  If a separate case needs to be purchased, this Kindle is no longer a good value, and will no longer be lightweight.  I probably won't purchase another, probably won't recommend it to family and friends.  The textured case was perfect for me.  (The previous one died in less than 2 years.  I'm no longer convinced Kindle is the brand for me.)

What is the giant bezel at the bottom for.  I set it up with my phone. It still managed to get network wrong and not be easy to fix the password for the network.  What happened to days when you didn't need a separate network or did I hallucinate that?  So far I see nothing to recommend this over reading on m smartphone or tablet on the app.  Why bother for an inferior smaller screen separate device experience?

reviewTitle: had 6th generation kindle book, brought new 11th generation.
reviewDescription: What i dont like is that the package they came in was like paperbag, no bubble wrap inside or a box with straform to protect the electronic kindle e-reader.  its my third order this week i been getting paperbag lately.  Otherwise, its a better version reader, and it a excellent lightweight to read and read at night time without wasting bookmark light on page holder.
I like the size it’s a little smaller than the others. I’m am disappointed in the battery life. I have to recharge every week. For a new purchase the battery should last much longer!

reviewTitle: The "All New Kindle" was a frustrating experience for me.
reviewDescription: I found the "All New Kindle" very clumsy and frustrating to operate and after struggling with it for too long, 3 weeks after the return eligibility date, I decided to bite the bullet and get myself a Paperwhite, which arrived today.  I'm in love with it from the start.  Don't waste your money on the "All New Kindle".  I'm so sorry I did!

reviewTitle: Purchased 4 months ago and will no longer take a charge,
reviewDescription: Easy to carry about and to read.  I did not like having books suggested to me constantly on the screen.  I would prefer a blank screen when shut down.Worst of all, after owning a using the device for 4 months, it will no longer permit the battery to charge and now its useless.
Compact and easy to use, but is very annoying as it is page turning is sensitive and jumps page frequently.
I like the display gor reading but trying to scroll through your library of books is so slow. It basically has to load every 4 books before continuing. For me the loading speed is a huge let down.

reviewTitle: Bought this to help my eyes
reviewDescription: But the strain is still there

reviewTitle: New software doesn't have time on top of screen and other bugs. Not impressed.
reviewDescription: Bought this to read in waiting rooms and leaving generation before it at home. biggest bug, if your age or a physical malady gives you the shakes you might skip ahead 1-20 pages ahead while trying for one. if your skin is dry it may take several taps to change a page and accidently swipe to change you may change tfont size several steps down. next biggest, if you have set your tablet down and sleeping (cover closed) and the internet is on at times when you wake it up it has changed from the page you we're reading to your library. Frankly although these new ones are easier on the eyes, more internet friendly and much lighter I wish I had my old Gen 3 push button model. Forgot, searching for books in your library stinks, swipe across swipe down who cares just enter the book name or author box would do fine. I'm not window shopping, I know what I want!

This would have been great for my first kindle reading experience however I had the kindle fire first. The ease of charging books is not great. Once a book is on your device there’s no ease of sending it to your library. I haven’t even had mine a year yet and it will not charge to 100%.

Updating my review. At first I was going to return the Kindle because I thought I got a faulty one. I am still really upset at how the screen constantly glitches and flashes between light and dark mode but it doesn't do it while you're reading which is the main purpose. It loads/scrolls very slow in the library/store but when reading you can turn pages quickly. When I flip pages it still occasionally flashes between modes but not often. After speaking with multiple other Kindle users I discovered this is normal for all Kindles apparently...

I am disappointed with the way this Kindle turns pages.  Often it goes forward (or backward) multiple pages and I have a hard time finding the last page I read.Otherwise, the Kindle is fine but this is so annoying and happens frequently enough that I am thinking of returning it for something else.

reviewTitle: I thought this was a kindle
reviewDescription: This is an e-reader

reviewTitle: Not as bright as my old Paperwhite Kindle
reviewDescription: My trusty old Paperwhite Kindle finally died after 10+ years.  I purchased this as the replacement -- but the screen is not as bright as the Paperwhite.  If you want the brightest easiest to read screen, I recommend choosing the Paperwhite model.  Except for that, this one is slim, small, very lightweight.

I was very surprised how slow this unit is.When turned on a message "waking up" is displayed for several seconds. This was not the case on my 7 year Kindle model.There is also an occasional lag time on page turns.  I'll tap the screen and when the page does not turn I'll tap again.  Then after I've read a couple of sentences the page will flip again.Amazon CS sent an email letting me know of a 9 step process I could do to update the unit (one would think this would happen seamlessly via WIFI, but no, you have to go through the process of hooking Kindle up to you PC to download the file.  And after all that it didn't make a difference,  Again my old Kindle was 7 years old and I never did anything to update it and I wish this unit was as good.
I liked the format on my old kindle more than this one I prefer to have script not photos of the books also would like to get rid of goodreads.

reviewTitle: If it wouldn’t keep shutting off on its on, it be good
reviewDescription: The issue is it regularly shuts itself off while reading with no rhyme or reason. I have been reading for the last half hour and it’s shut off 4 times.

I purchased my new kindle in Feb 2023. It is now July 6, 2023, and as of 2 days ago, it would not accept books borrowed from my local library.And will not "update" my Kindle Store experience.  I have restarted three times, factory restarted, and sitll not able to retrieve my borrowed books.I Have gone through Customer Service at Amazon.  I really don't want to purchase ANOTHER NEW Kindle.SW
It seems the Kindle's only last six months now.  Purchased one in January - screened died. Purchased new in June - December Now and black screen again!!!

reviewTitle: Confusing and frustrating to set up
reviewDescription: I bought two for my parents. This device was not made with the user in mind at all. The setup process took a full hour and a half. It was confusing and directionless. I had to create a kindle account then an Amazon account then connect the Amazon account to the kindle account then some random thing called “good reads” popped up and needed to have an account. Then we couldn’t get going on anything without adding a credit card. Then at the end we couldn’t figure out where to even purchase a Kindle Unlimited subscription. We spent thirty minutes on the kindle app trying to figure out why we we only could download “samples” of books only to realize that we can only buy books off Amazon. This is insanely convoluted and not intuitive. I am beyond frustrated. My parents are unlikely to use these devices if they have to switch between multiple apps just to find a book.

There's a poor contrast to the pictures of the books. The sync is terrible. The Kindle app on my Samsung tablet is much more enjoyable to read. Swiping the touch screen to turn the pages sometimes turns about 5 of them. The only good thing has been the battery life. I bought it in March and haven't enjoyed it yet. It still hasn't downloaded a sample that I chose earlier even though it's on my phone.

reviewTitle: DO NOT PAY TO REMOVE ADS UP FRONT
reviewDescription: I paid for ads to be removed when purchasing the device initially. When I activated the device, it came with ads, though I was charged the extra fee up front. When checking my Amazon account, I could see that though the fee had been invoiced and paid, "Special Offers" had not been removed and I was prompted to pay an additional fee to get rid of ads. When calling customer support, they initially told me that it was not possible to remove ads, then offered a refund, then after 1 hour finally disabled the ads on my device. I hope my experience using the device isn't as bad as this experience trying to simply get what I rightly paid for. I recommend removing ads after receiving your device to ensure proper activation and to save an hour of your time troubleshooting with customer support.

So far it's nothing like the original, easy-to-use, easy-to-read Kindle.  (If I could have found a refurbished original, I would have bought it in a heartbeat.)  It's a small device that has many mysterious touch and swipe controls that you must remember, and you almost can't help touching the touchscreen when you handle it - which then takes unwanted actions because you touched it.  The screen lets you read half a page at a time, which is like reading it on my phone.  I'm not sure I'm going to keep it, but I don't want to pay $300 for a more user-friendly Kindle, either.

I want to preface this by saying I love the Kindle and have owned 4 Kindles total. I also have convinced several people in my life to buy a kindle, because I truly believe it is a life changing product.However, I feel like the quality of the Kindle basic has really gone downhill. I first bought this in October as soon as it was available, but I had to contact customer service because I noticed my Kindle has a crack on the side - only a few weeks into using it. Amazon was great and sent me a brand new replacement a few months ago, however, I just discovered a new crack in my replacement device! I haven't dropped the kindle or put it through excessive wear. The plastic itself is quite flimsy and lightweight, so I'm not surprised it hasn't held up all that long. I wish I had gone for the Kindle Paperwhite instead

Honestly I was so excited to get my first kindle and sign up for kindle unlimited, but this isn’t what I expected at all. The battery life is not at all what they advertise. Unless you are using this once a week there is no was a full battery will last you more then 2 days.The system is glitchy as hell. Im having to restart it whenever I wake it up or I can’t access the kindle store to find a book. It’ll say it’s still connected to Wi-Fi then won’t let you search anything. Not to mention it keeps forgetting that I have a kindle unlimited subscription and won’t let me use it unless I reset it.It’s so frustrating since I was beyond excited to get this. Massive disappointment. Can’t recommend it to anyone else as I’ve had issues with it since I got it.

reviewTitle: Can't manage kids content because I am in a different country
reviewDescription: I bought this kindle for my very avid reader 10yo daughter. I want to manage the content she is able to read but I can't access the parents dashboard because I am in a country that is not US, UK, Germany, Canada or Japan.Contacted Customer service and the answer is that there is no option.I am not happy having to set and adult account to my 10yo kid so she will be able to read what I want her to read.

I don't understand what's going on with my new Kindle. I loved my old one. I've had this one for just a little while. Maybe a month or so and I've had to restart it or reset it almost once every week due to the screen freezing and not responding. I'm very disappointed

reviewTitle: The device works as it is supposed to, but start-up was terrible,
reviewDescription: It took my wife a couple days to finally make connection with Kindle and learn how to connect and upload books.  Initially it said that she already was a user.  Well that was several years ago and obviously the password was forgotten and it wouldn't connect with the "forgot Password" link.  Very disappointing that the connection process wasn't simple...  it should be.

I love my kindle and the access to lots of books. It’s great to travel with and that’s mostly why I bought it. The thing that drives me crazy is the white line down the middle of the page. Since no one else has said anything about it I assume that it’s not supposed to be there. I can still read but it can be distracting at times. Anyone else have this? Is it normal?

reviewTitle: Not like the Kindle app at all!
reviewDescription: It is very frustrating to try and find a book on this device. I suppose I was spoiled over the years with my old Kindle Fire and the way it loaded and displayed books. Also the Kindle app on my other devices where the books return to the spot I  put them in in my collections. If you are used to using the Kindle app this will be a new learning experience.  I also have trouble finding a book by looking at the covers as so many of them are so hard to see. I prefer my color covers. The statement that you can read on this device for days doesn't hold true for me. I am sure most people don't read as much as me and won't have to charge their device nearly every day like i do. All said, I prefer my old Kindle to this one and wish I had done more research before buying it.

As above, quite disappointed. The print is difficult to read as it seems faded, and no adjustment makes it better.  Very slow to turn the page or get to the settings page. My old Kindle Fire is much better in those areas.  I purchased this thinking it would e an improvement.  No so much. Maybe I got a defective one.

reviewTitle: worked well for 11 months then failed - touchscreen keeps turning pages without being touched
reviewDescription: I have had this for almost a year - now it just keeps turning pages and changing fonts without being touched - I have tried factory resets and cleaning the screen but it doesnt  help.My impression is the later generations of kindles are not as durable as the earlier ones (this is my 4th or 5th kindle and the earlier ones lasted many years)In typical amazon fashion it took me a persistent hour of searching and finally finding a way to get customer support (in about the 5th place I looked) - even though it still should be under warrantee the button to replace was not on the orders screen. I finally got in a chat with customer support and they agreed to replace it. They really design their support system to discourage all but the most persistent people.

reviewTitle: All you get is the Kindle. No directions or use info
reviewDescription: The device is fine. It is very lightweight. It does look really cheaply made, but so far it has been serviceable.You are left to try to figure out how to use the item, and where/what downloads are free and for what period of time.

reviewTitle: Third one to die in 6-13 months
reviewDescription: I am not happy with the longevity of these devices. One replaced at no charge. 2nd I did not return on time, my fault. Third just died on my after purchasing Jan 2023.
I was so attached to my former Kindle, but after 12 yrs -- and a couple hundred books -- it finally crapped out. This model is an 'ok' replacement, but not as comfortable to use as its predecessor.

This is my first kindle purchase and as much as I like it, I will have to return it. The first day I turned it on and starting using it, I noticed the battery was draining a bit quickly. So I charged it to 100% to test theory and straight from the charger at 100% battery life, my battery dropped to 80% without continuous use. Then about 15min after seeing 80%, I turned it back on to start reading and the battery had dropped again to 78% without any use at all.Not sure if mine is just defective, but unfortunately I will have to return it. I will be purchasing the kindle paperwhite it it’s place and hopefully that works better.
The kindle is very light and easy to read. It came partially charged. But there was no power cord included  I’m still waiting to receive one
The screen glitches a lot when you move around anywhere on the home screen and sometimes when flipping pages as well.

reviewTitle: I like the size but stop working after 45 days
reviewDescription: I like it while it work. The new software version makes the Kindle reboot and turn off automatically.  At the beginning it was a few times every other day. But now is like every 20 min or it would not work at all.Amazon should fix it.And no customer support

I bought the Kindle so I could stop reading my books on my phone. The Kindle is very slow and laggy even after it updated. It does this glitch thing every time you click on something or turn the page. Very annoying. I'm not satisfied with this purchase at all... My kindle was exchanged and it does the same thing as the first one purchased. My rating stands.

reviewTitle: This is worthless to me if I have no idea how to get it to work!
reviewDescription: Where are the instructions?
Slow to respond to commands, hard to figure out how to get back to library once book is finished. Slow page turning. Doesn’t seem any better than the kindle I’d had 10+ years ago.
It’s small. Close to cell phone size. Black and white - hate shopping for new books in black and white. And I don’t like I can’t buy ebooks on my Amazon app or on my kindle app. 😔

The only positive about this Kindle is the battery life - I can read all day and more without multiple charges. Otherwise, I hate it. Turning on the device shows multiple books, on multiple pages, most of which I never ordered. I can no longer determine quickly which books  I've read, which are waiting to be read. I can't make out from directions how to return the screen to anything resembling my old Kindle, which was easy to navigate. If my old Kindle hadn't died, I'd have gone back to it.

While reading is great, getting to actually read is borderline impossible. Navigating menus feels like it’s from 1992, loading between screens and libraries is painful. Even trying to actually manage your library on the device is regrettably useless.Do not recommend as there are far faster readers out there.

reviewTitle: Hardest Kindle EVER to Get Set Up
reviewDescription: This is my third Kindle, and I've never had so much hassle trying to get a device set up and operational!  The "help" screens are NOT much help, and I'm still fighting hours later to get a book downloaded that I was in the middle of on my old Kindle.  It's tempting to take a sledgehammer to this one and try to get the old one to limp along long enough to get through the books I've already purchased.  Perhaps it's time to try a Nook?

It is so hard to navigate around. Very difficult to get to your library. Touching and swiping everywhere just to get nowhere.  Very irritating. I do like how light it is and it showing the time at the top.

I just got this Kindle 11/18/23, already charged it once, and it's already at 30% on 11/22/23. Probably doesn't help that you can't turn the screen off.I like it, just wish the book covers were in color, it hurts my eyes trying to find a book to read.I do like that I can read it in full sunlight though, and can dim it enough to read at night.I've seen that it fits in pockets, but only my hoodie pocket is big enough to fit it. But it's easy to hold it one handed.It's sturdy though doesn't feel cheaply made.

reviewTitle: A step down from the original
reviewDescription: But then, what can one expect these days?  My original Kindle lasted ten years of abuse; this one will be lucky to survive for five.  It's lighter, flimsier, and dependent on excessive software.  It comes packed with "special features" that have to be turned off in order to simply read a book.  It updates itself without permission and when specifically told NOT to.  It thinks it knows everything and won't accept correction without elaborate and annoying procedures that have to be done over EVERY SINGLE TIME.  And it won't easily scroll ahead without activating ADDITIONAL secret menus that have to be stumbled upon by multiple procedures. Frankly, it's making me wonder if I should just try to replace the battery on the old one.Amazon, you screwed up in your efforts to continue screwing your customers.  If you want to sell to people who aren't addicted to their cell phones, you need to make the device LESS like a cell phone, and more like, you know, A BOOK.

I've been using a kindle since the beginning, owning plenty over the years. The only reason I bought this was for the backlight, which really is great and doesn't hurt the eyes.This version is super light and fairly slippery, making it uncomfortable to hold. Gone is that slightly non slip backing. Definitely a form over function design. A small bevel is not ideal for comfort.The swipe vs button for page changing means if you are holding it with your left hand, you have to move your right hand from resting to turn the page. It's just one of those things that a physical button makes for a more enjoyable experience.The touch only can also be a pain when wanting to use the dictionary. Sometimes it will turn the page, several times I don't know what I did but it took me several chapters ahead.Seems like it was designed not by an avid kindle user.I'll get a case which I think will help for holding. Again the backlight is great.
It's slow, it doesn't show color, but it does do what it claims to do. I'm going to buy the 2023 kindle.

I’ve been using my new kindle (2022 version) for a few months now, and I’m not impressed. My last kindle was a 2016 paper white and was a much better product. I only decided to replace it because it had begun to freeze up on occasion. The new 2022 model is slower to open, has a much shorter battery life, and skips pages about every third time i turn a page. Not sure what Amazon thought was an improvement about this model. For me, it’s a step back. Disappointing
As other reviews have stated it kinda glitches out with each touch, does like a negative image then loads the next page. Really annoying I don’t understand why a new product in 2023 would do this.

I like my kindle, but I don’t use it as often as I expected to. I normally read on the kindle app on my iPad. I bought the kindle months ago to carry with me for the carline and Dr appts. It doesn’t perform how I thought it would. It’s a little slower, not as smooth when scrolling, and I hate looking for books on it. I do still use it, just not like I thought I would. The 3 months of ku were great though!

This is the second Kindle I have bought.  From the very beginning the battery does not last a week,  more or less weeks.  Now, it will not charge at all and it is only 6 months old.  My son is depending on this to access his college textbooks.  Now his grades are dependent on it and he cannot finish the semester.  Can the battery be defective from the start? Are there any options to get a replacement? HELP!!

reviewTitle: A bit lighter than last model; more comfortable to hold. Page turning NOT better.
reviewDescription: Like others have mentioned in reviews - this device sometimes has some erratic behavior when turn pages. For me it mostly happens when turning back a page. About 1 out of 5 times it goes forward, or back multiple pages. I have had multiple e-readers for years, I know I how to swipe and/or tap to go forward and backward. It is lighter and that is most important to me. Good battery life, good brightness, clear display.

reviewTitle: Not the same as old kindle
reviewDescription: This thing is tiny and have to have a headset to listen to books

This is my fourth or fifth kindle and while the ebook itself warrants no complaints, the purchase has raised my ire.It’s pretty shady, IMHO, to not only not supply a charging cord, but to make the receptacle a different size from the universal one.Shame on you, Amazon, for cheating out and gouging your customers. You’ve basically made your product unusable unless the purchaser shells out more money.

reviewTitle: great for reading but could use a better UI
reviewDescription: i was torn when buying this because i love physical books, but i got it on prime day and in general i love it. it makes reading in bed so much easier and kindle unlimited is really nice. the only thing i’m not a fan of is that using the kindle store on it sucks and can be very slow and laggy to load stuff or register your click. sometimes i will restart it if it gets too laggy. as far as the reading experience goes, it’s really nice to have a dark mode and i love that i can just click a word and it had the definition. it’s a little smaller than i expected but for the price it’s nice. if i had the money i would have gotten the paper white though.

reviewTitle: Not as easy to use as my 2015 model.
reviewDescription: My old 2015 Ereader was more user friendly than this new one.The older model had the book titles listed in easy to read print. The new one shows pictures of books that are hard to read. Also, can't figure out how to delete a book after I have read it.Having to have to push the on/off button every time I want to use it is less convenient than the old one that automatically turned on when you opened the reader.  Also, the holder for the old reader is too big for new new one, which makes it difficult to use the on/off button.

I've been using Kindle Fires for reading but bought the 2022 Kindle 6" because it has a lot more storage and is lightweight. I didn't like it. The touch screen is slow to respond, and I have to touch each tiny thing just right to get the screen to obey. It's very difficult to access the top and bottom of the page when reading. Scrolling from one page to the next while reading is subject to delay as the current page fades out before being replaced by the next, a tiny delay to be sure but annoying. I'm returning it and will wait for another sale to try something else.

I enjoy reading. A lot. I thought it would be nice to have something book size to read with instead of using my phone and draining the battery. The charger length on the battery is outstanding. I received this Thursday and I have yet needed to charge it. The problem with this is it is so slow. Trying to move between books or start a new one or even buy a new one. It took me 20 minutes to buy a book this afternoon. I almost gave up and went to my phone. Frustrating!

reviewTitle: Great Size Lack of Non-Waterproof Sucks
reviewDescription: I didn’t like that they decided to make the Paperwhites bulkier.  So decided to go with this.  Overall is has most of what I wanted.  It’s a little more compact than my last Paperwhite (and much smaller than the new ones).  I like the pin lock option.I’ve taken two stars off because this is not water proof, and they don’t offer a waterproof option.I do a lot of reading around water, so this not being water proof is a real annoyance.  I’ve got to throw it in a water proof case and of course remember to bring a water proof case if I’m around water.  I don’t get why they decided not to offer a waterproof version.  Someone who wants a smaller more portable Kindle is probably going to carry it in places where it can get wet (as opposed to a larger one that probably never leaves the house).  You’d think if they were choosing whether to make a bulky kindle waterproof or a smaller one, they’d make it the smaller one.
Ads… so many ads. And they want $20 to remove them. Or I can return it and buy the ad free version… for $20 extra lol

I've had a few Kindles, the one prior to this one is the same version but it's 2019.  My older Kindle has a nice feel to it, it is smooth all the way to the edge and around the edge of the front of the unit.  The seam where the front and back connect is on the back of the device, I've never noticed it.  This new Kindle has the seam for the front and back pcs on the top edge so you feel that ridge when you hold the device.  The material it is made of like cheap plastic that is not smooth with the seam all the way around the unit.  I might just package it up and return it...
This kindle seems to get stuck, doesn't engage often.  Have to turn it off and on to correct this.

The screen leaves burn from the previous image. You can see where the book cover "Midnight Sun" has a burn of my book cover of "Fright Night". (Don't judge my vampire reading!!!) Also "Sunshine" has a burn of the hair and eyes  from the cover of "Written in Red". This burn isn't an issue when reading regular text, but if you were to read a graphic novel with it, this is a potential problem.The screen from my 7th generation Kindle Paperwhite has sharper images too... Right is the Paperwhite 7th generation. The left is the new Kindle 2022 release. Even though both have 300ppi, the contrast is better on the Paperwhite. Both were lit to 15.I do like the fact that the new Kindle is lighter and smaller, so reading for an extended amount of time causes less wrist strain. (Wow that sounds spoiled.) However, it feels flimsy, so I worry about its durability if I were to take it on the go.Update 10/17 - Amazon sent me a replacement. It still has bad screen burn, so it wasn't just my unit. It must just be the nature of the item. If you are planning to buy this item, just know that there will be an issue with images.

This is my 4th kindle and I wanted a faster processor for better responsiveness.  It's only marginally better, display is better, but the on off button is too sensitive and shuts off all the time.  Also, the frame of the kindle is cracking on the corners and is not nearly as durable as the old ones I have had.  I wanted a better kindle.  So disappointing to waste money on this one.  I am using my old one now
So much smaller than the older kindles

tHE SET UP  WAS PROBLEMMATIC ...support & I were on the phone fo long I felt we should exchange Xmas cards. Howver I must give credit to the support people working on the proble...very polite,patient  & helpful in explaning what the problem was & how they were trying to fix it. After 2 calls & total of  almost 3 hours!I was  tired ...it was late, said I would call back next day.  Checked  first thing  in the moring and it worked!!!  I played with it for a while enjoying my morning coffee ...discoverd the program set up will take some getting used to...and most important  arthritic hands, swiping the screen several times trying to highlight interesting  parts of the ebook without being the screen changing, then having to go back to begining of book to try again ... very frustrating ...over all it  has some very good features..and at this point I think  worth working with it and trying to adapt my physical  problems  with the unit.

reviewTitle: BEWARE - kindle unlimited bundle CANNOT be purchased on phome
reviewDescription: This review is not about the kindle itself but about the bundle and Amazons customer service.I bought a kindle basic with 3 months free of kindle unlimited but supposedly since I bought it on my phone I don’t get it. Apparently apple takes money from Amazon when digital items are purchased and Amazon doesn’t like it so you can’t purchase subscription or digital items on your phone. How am I suppose to know that?! So I call trying to get my 3 free months anyways and their response is to return it, wait for the credit then repurchase it with the option of the 3 free months. IT IS THE SAME PRICE WITH OR WITHOUT IT! Why could they just credit me for the 3 months it’s $36. They made $2.5 billion on prime day! What happened to one time courtesy and customer service! I’m beyond disappointed 😡

reviewTitle: Glitchy and not very touch sensitive
reviewDescription: I’ll start off with what I like about this kindle. For one I love the small size. It’s a little bigger than the size of my hand and feels cozy to read with. But what I have noticed after using it for the last few weeks is that when I tap to turn the page, it sometimes doesn’t register that I’ve tapped the screen and I have to tap it a little harder to get the page to turn. I wish it were just a little more sensitive to touch. I have also noticed that sometimes if I tap the screen to turn the page, it will turn two or three pages ahead and that has happened quite a few times. I then need to go back and find my spot in the book which is a bit irritating. In some ways, I wish I had bought the oasis so that these problems could have been avoided with the buttons that kindle has. Lastly I have noticed when reading that occasionally the whole screen will change from dark mode to day mode/vice versa quickly when I turn the page. That’s a little irritating at night when I have it on dark mode and it will flash bright for a second when I don’t expect it. Over all though I do like this kindle. I like how small it is and how I can easily take it in my purse or bag anywhere. I just wish these little glitches didn’t happen so often. I agree with most reviewers saying that it’s a good starter kindle because of the price, size, and how light weight it is.
And only in black and white it feels so fragile and you can't turn it off. Idk how I feel about this yet!! Not what I expected
It was excruciating to use this. I felt like it was so slow. Get an iPad and the kindle app, you’ll be much better off.

reviewTitle: Too small for me causes my hands to cramp.
reviewDescription: My husband has a Kindle and encouraged me to get one too.  So I did and thought I was getting one like his.  But the one I got was smaller and without a cover to shut it off and turn it on.  His Kindle is easier to change from one screen to the other. Mine is so small while holding it my hands tend to cramp.  It is more difficult to get to my library and fine the books I have already read.  We shared books but that too has become more difficult.  Guess I am just trying to work OUT All the bugs!
I bought this kindle a couple months back and I loved it until it stopped connecting to WiFi recently. Anyone know contact information for customer service?

reviewTitle: Hard to find and choose books
reviewDescription: The fact that it only comes in black, white and grey color makes it difficult to shop. Cover art on books aren’t appealing without color.

For the most part, a nice little reader. But it doesn't quite fit in your hand without putting your fingers on the screen. But the worst thing is that you think it's warranted for a year ... and then it breaks ... and then you try ... and then you try to warn someone else.
Lower quality than other models. Amazon support has been nonexistent.

I have to consistently restart the Kindle. It frequently freezes on a blank screen when I’m attempting to use the Kindle Store. I receive the notification, “Updating your Kindle Store. Will take less than one minute”. Restarting isn’t always helpful. Often I have to set it aside & just try again later. It is super frustrating.

I have had this for 3 months. It will not take a charge. I tried to return it for an exchange but it will not let me. Only gives me the option to trouble shoot. Which I tried and it didn't work. Very disappointing!

reviewTitle: Everyone should be speaking up regarding having to pay to NOT want advertising on an Ereader!
reviewDescription: I cannot see why anyone would want to have ads pop-up on an e reader, when it is, after all a book. To be interrupted on a regular basis to have to view advertisements is absurd, not to mention charging $20 to have them removed is pretty low, as if the price of the reader isn't enough.  You are reading a book, not a magazine. Does anyone else feel this way?, it is ridiculous; I am waiting for some support for this crazy interruption of reading our books; it is totally uncalled for.
I can't figure out how Kindle works as far as accessing what I think I've bought to read. That undoubtedly is user error on my part.

The biggest selling point for me was the length of time per battery charge but if something seems to good to be true, sometimes it really is. I would be happy with 2 weeks. Maybe I'm doing something wrong? I close it every time I quit reading but so far, 5-6 days is the maximum time a charge lasts. I'm 72 and I read a lot but nowhere does it say you can only use it sparingly for long battery life. What am I doing wrong?

I’m not sure if it’s just a defect in the kindle I got but the battery life it terrible compared to the earlier model I have. My use is the same and the battery is only lasting a couple days compared to weeks like my older model. Really disappointed.

I got this kindle as a birthday gift. I loved it until now. I haven’t used it for maybe a month or two. I plugged it in to charge and now the screen is stuck like this. I can’t get it to restart or reset. I still have access to all my books on my phone app but I want to be able to use my kindle. Any help or advice would be nice.
I accidentally ordered this Kindle when I was trying to replace the Kindle Paper White that stopped working. I returned it.
Pay more for a bigger version and has more features. Bought it as a gift for the other as it is easier on their eyes than cellphone and s7fe tablet.

This is my first kindle and I was super excited to get it…but now I wish I had just continued reading on the app with my phone.How can a device by Amazon designed to read ebooks, work so poorly at doing the one thing it’s supposed to do?!First of all it’s pretty slow and laggy. When you swipe the page the lag is weird. You can also see the last page’s words slightly on the background. Like what?!  Same deal with the progression bar at the bottom. If you switch between page number and how long is left In the chapter/book you can still slightly see the previous.Kindles have been around for a while, I can't believe they function this poorly.

I had a kindle about 10 years ago that had buttons on the side. I found this new version to be a big downgrade. Not being able to touch the screen to grip the thing limits the number of ways you can hold it. Also it often detects double touches or the wrong type of touch or area of touch when I just want to turn the page. They made the body with a finish that is very slippery, so you are either forced to buy their case, suffer, or improvise like I did by applying several talon grip strips to the back and sides. I wish I could just buy the old model again.
For a novice, the instructions are not adequate.  You have to have some idea of what to do in order to get to them.

reviewTitle: item is 2022 release but it doesn't have any tradein value for amazon tablet.  SAD!!
reviewDescription: easy to read. easy to handle. but item doesn't have any value in January 2024.  SADcannot trade in for tablet

I have been using this Kindle for 10 months.  It is my third Kindle .  It is light weight with good battery life and sharp text.  My problem is with the page turning. At random times it skips two pages ahead instead of one.  Granted a minor problem but my two older Kindles did not do this and this Kindle did not do this at first.  I have tried changing my finger pressure, different locations on the screen, and duration of the tap but nothing makes a difference.  I like this Kindle but I don't love it.

I guess I missed something because I didn’t realize that my books purchased from Apple, from Barnes & Noble, or borrowed  from my library on the Libby app, could not run on Kindle.  It’s a nice device— though small— but I didn’t want to be shut out from all the other content providers. Buying Kindle Unlimited is pricey seeing as these others have books on sale for $1-$5 and library books are free. I have apps on my iPhone that allow me a much greater choice so guess I’ll stick with reading on my iPhone or iPad.

This kindle is solely for reading. It looks like you're reading on paper which feels much better for my eyes than the app. The app has great features which are also available on this device. I love that it is compact! I bought a case for it, with straps to keep it in my hands. Sometimes I miss having a paperback, but then I read one and there's no built in dictionary, I can't highlight my favorite lines and it I have no room on my shelves; then I remember the beauty of an eReader. I had a Nook before but I believe the kindle to be superior (your page number is remembered even if you forget to put a bookmark)!My biggest complaint is that the Kindle puts itself into sleep mode sometimes before I'm even finished with the page.  It has to have a really low setting like 2 minutes and after searching the settings, it doesn't appear to be adjustable which is ridiculous. I've never seen a device that you can't adjust the sleep timer.
Para un adulto no es bueno, es demasiado pequeño y no se ve bien

Love the Kindle ereader. This was not my first one--more like my 4th or 5th ereader but I have Kindle Unlimited and read a lot of books. I love the blue color of this one and it worked great...until it stopped working. I left it charging when I went to work--came home and the screen is frozen. Can't turn it off/back on; can't get into any functions; charge light is dead, too. Bought it January 2023, and it's now December 2023--almost made it to a full year.
I ordered to replace older Kindle because ppi had been bumped up a little for ease of viewing. Could see no appreciable difference. Oh well.

reviewTitle: Not what I was hoping for battery wise
reviewDescription: I have only ever had one Kindle; the very first one that came out. It’s like brand new. I take excellent care of it. However, it’s not backlit and putting a light on it makes the device heavier. It’s not touch screen either. There’s also problems using the store on it because it’s so old. I decided to look into an upgraded version. I found this newest model that’s the same size, backlit, touch screen, and the battery is supposed to last weeks on end. Just what I was looking for. I’ve been using the new device for about 5 days now, and I’m not impressed with the battery life. I turned down the brightness and even put it into airplane mode and still I’m charging it after every time I read (gets down into the low 40%s, which isn’t enough for the next time I go to read since it loses power even when off). I turned the device off while in airplane mode and left it overnight and all day. This evening I turned it on and it went from 94% last night to 87% when I turned it on. I don’t get that because the device was off, not asleep. Anyways, I’m keeping it because of the new features, but the battery definitely does not stand even close to my first kindle. That battery is going strong and lasts me weeks on end. Disappointed.

I bought this kindle as a Christmas givt with a cover to fit.  The unfortunate thing about it is that the sensitivity of the page turning swipe does not work.  Either it stays still..... OR and even worse, it jumps about 10 pages somehow. WTH?  This isn't a 1 time fluke, but  happens regularly.  I do like it's light weight, the options for size of text, the light which allows you to read at night etc.  But that 1 thing, the page turning, is really a deal breaker.

reviewTitle: Received it but it might be faulty? Not sure. Not crisp enough
reviewDescription: It doesn’t seem like the black on the screen is black enough. When I swipe, some things become kind of pixelated for a moment. It also seems laggy.All videos I’ve seen the screen looks crisp but mine seems faded

This unit does have some good features but it does not feel as well made as my previous kindle touch. It seems to have taken a step back from what was one step now takes two or more. The reading speed in this new unit set in the same spot as my touch in the same book same font and print size takes 9 or 10 minutes longer. I am just not overall impressed with the software system and how the unit works.  I will be returning.

I have have had the 10 gen which has a glitch when you turn the page it goes ahead several pages. I have the 2023 which has many glitches one being it ends the book when you turn a page. So I tried then 11th and sad to say it turns 2 pages for every page turn. It’s frustrating but not as bad as the 10th or the new 2023. Overall I love the compact size the 2023 is too big, the lighting is great too.
Looks just like paper, yet the screen scratches easily.

I really do love my kindle. My husband gifted it to me for my underways, its kept me from bringing 10+ books with me on the boat. It has survived a whole 7 month deployment. Until half way through, its screen stayed frozen on the tree loading screen. When I got home I was able to unfreeze it by plugging it into my computer and holding the button.
