Also, I bought the case and while the case is very nice, the Kindle can't stand on its own! A decided disadvantage when one wants to read while doing something like eating a sandwich. You need to prop it up between two heavier units like books so you can get a hands-free reading angle..

I love to read on the Kindle, as it is lightweight and convenient to keep on me while out and about. The only downside is that the technology seems a little outdated. Sometimes the screen “buffers” between pages. Navigating how to find the home screen was also a challenge at first.

This kindle is very light weight and the perfect size to carry around in my bag. If you have eye sensitivity from screens or get migraines easily, this could be an easier option for you as I have found it has helped me. The screen isn't nearly as harsh as that of a phone or computer. The battery life on it is great and it charges pretty quickly. My only complaint is it runs a little slow and the kindle store could be more user friendly.

Although this arrived late and support was no help I did buy this for my daughter in law who is an avid reader and she absolutely loves it. She no longer has to worry about buying books and worry about them getting destroyed.

Love the new kindle. It’s lightweight compact and just really portable. However the charge seems to be less than stated. And the screen tends to shake when flipping pages, it’s more noticeable on this model than previous versions.

I enjoy reading, but carrying around books is a drag.  I was looking for something a bit larger than my phone, smaller than a tablet, and easier on my eyes.  This has been perfect for me.  Use it several days a week, it is easy to read on, I can carry it in backpack, or even in the cargo pocket of my pants.  Holds plenty of books, does not need internet connection, so reading anywhere is fine.  Battery life is incredible, I think I have charged it 2 or 3 times since I got it a few months ago.  Didn't need charging, just saw the plug and thought I would "top it off" while I had a plug handy.4 stars as I thought there used to be a way to get the Washington post on it.  For a while, I think they were sending out a daily copy and delivering it to some of my devices, but I have not found a way to do that with this (read that they have stopped doing this).  Would have been a nice feature.  But if you like reading, or need to read for work, this is a great little device.
Best investment so far . East to use and easy to read on always looking forward to read my kindle . I just hate how the places the lock button at the bottom .

i ordered this on prime day in hopes that it’ll help me read more. i got this about four days ago and i’ve read two books since i opened it!! i love it, it’s easy to customize your reading experience and i love easily checking my progress in a book at the bottom. two things i have noticed: when you’re trying to do anything other than just flipping the pages or highlighting passages it’s kind of slow. it takes about a second to respond to touches and you’re also not able to continuously scroll, but both of those things are easy to get past because it doesn’t interrupt your reading experience. the other thing is the battery; it says the battery lasts weeks but i did charge it to 100% last night and after ~12 hours it’s at 50% when i haven’t used it at all. this also really isn’t a big deal to me, the battery doesn’t drain like crazy and i can just charge it as needed but it is false advertising. that might just be from it showing ads while on sleep mode though. i did have to find a youtube video on how to get back to the home screen from a book lol. overall, very worth it, especially with the 3 months free kindle unlimited it comes with. on the listing there were two options, one for the 3 months free and one without and it wouldn’t let me choose the one with the free trial, but when i booted up the kindle it gave me the free trial anyway. i have no real complaints, everything i mentioned is so easy to get past since it is such a small device and can’t be expected to be way powerful, i got it for a good price and will be getting a lot of use out of it!!
Portátil, dura mucho la batería, el único defecto es que no tiene la entrada actualizada para cargarlo.
Got this as a gift for someone. They absolutely love it - easily portable and great quality.
I use this product just to read good books for pleasure and I like it a lot.
Bought it for my wife. She likes reading before bed. It light weight and easy to read from. She loves it!

reviewTitle: GREAT quality for price; BUY IT!!!!
reviewDescription: My husband surprised me with this for my birthday, and I am greatly pleased. It is the perfect size for holding and very light so I even forget that I’m holding it while I’m reading. They give you three months of a free trial for you to get to read all Kindle unlimited books, which is so worth it since they could go for about $15-$20 each. There is a light mode and a dark mode. The battery lasts a very long time as well. It seems to be very durable, but I will still get a case for it. If you’re wanting to get into reading, this is worth it for the price. I will say that due to the mat material on the back fingerprints show so you will occasionally have to wipe it off, but it’s not a big deal.
This is a simple yet amazing product, if you read a lot, do yourself a favor and buy one.
Got this for my girlfriend for christmas, and she absolutely loves it. Great gift!

reviewTitle: Revised review - My opinion of it is vastly improved
reviewDescription: Now that I've had it for more than a month, I've come to like it much more. Here's why:The set up with Amazon was flawless and very fast and easy. My whole library showed up with no problems. It is super lightweight and I was able to purchase a really nice cover at a much cheaper price (<$10) than the cover for my previous Oasis. I like the Dark Mode for night time reading better than the nighttime screen on my previous Oasis. I find I don't miss the page turner button at all now. And now that I've gotten used to turning pages, there is no problem with multiple pages or skipping ahead. There are plenty of fonts to choose from. Unlike the battery life in my old Oasis, which I had to charge almost daily, this one really last for a week or more on a single charge and I read a lot every day. (I do keep the airplane mode on and the wifi off to preserve battery life, except when I'm downloading a new book.) In fact, I'll never purchase another Oasis for nearly $300 when this basic Kindle for a little over $100 is just as good. So I'm bumping my rating from a 3 to a 5.I do still think Amazon should make the battery accessible for replacement; not doing so makes their climate pledge hypocritical, and the fact that the battery on previous models was replaceable, but is not now, and they pretty much keep this a secret is typically nefarious.______________________________________________________________________________________________My original review after receiving it in Sept 2023 was "Pretty Good - meh" Rating: 31. The battery life is certainly much improved over previous models/generations. I read a lot and don't have to recharge for a week or two. With my previous Oasis 10th generation, had to charge daily.2. All features are adequate.3. When turning p ages, it sometimes turns more than one page; not always.4. Amazon's "Climate Pledge Friendly Products with trusted sustainability certification" is a joke. All the Kindles currently available have been designed so that the back cannot be removed to replace the battery when the time comes that it can no longer hold a charge.  Earlier versions had back designed to be removed and batteries were available from 3rd party vendors to extend the life of the device. But no more. Now that would have been climate friendly. But instead, Amazon has built in obsolescence by making battery replacement impossible. No, Amazon can't even replace them, nor can a repair shop. So since the max life expectancy of a battery is up to 3 years, I will be buying the cheapest kindle available; no more Oasis models for me. It seems awful greedy of Amazon to make this change wee we will all have to purchases a new Kindle every few years rather than just replace a battery.
So much easier on my eyes with paper white feature. I recommend using this.
Avid paperback reader and I’m obsessed with my kindle! Great buy and highly recommend!
I am so glad I bought this. It’s so compact and lightweight I always have it in my purse! I read so much more now because I don’t carry around large books anymore.

Love this Kindle… it’s so lightweight. It’s made of plastic. It is user friendly, little tutorial to start and easy to use. I was able to add my existing Kindle account with no problem. Great to use on a plane, or at night while my partner is sleeping.

I love my kindle and have read so many books since getting it.  The only complaint I have is I can't get my earbuds to connect to it to listen to the audiobooks (small issue for me since I also have the kindle app on my phone.  I have taken my kindle to the lake and it lasted well over a week before needing a charge.

Replaced my original kindle with this one. Love it. Light weight so I can take it with me all the time. Now have something to read anytime I have to wait either for appointments. Hardly know it is in my purse.
It's super lightweight and easy to use. Love reading it in bed before I fall asleep. It doesn't hurt my arms holding it while lying down and helps me fall asleep.
So much easier on the eyes than the kindle fire. Never used my fire as a tablet anyway, so this is perfect. Fits easily in my purse
If you’re on the fence about buying this, this is your sign to purchase. I bought it for my s/o as an xmas gift and she uses it every night and still talks about how much she loves it!

reviewTitle: Much better than reading from phone/tablet
reviewDescription: PROS:Very close to paper book experienceMuch better for eyesVery convenient built-in dictionary and searchEndless batteryCan load books from public libraryUSB type CCONSNone

I am a die hard paper back book fan, but I can only store so many books!! Traveling is difficult with physical books if you are close to ending one book & starting another! I was hesitant but I love this kindle! It did take a little bit for me to get used to it, but I really do love it! It is smaller than I originally thought but you can change font size to make sure reading is easy. I prefer the smallest size font so the physical book page is the same length as the kindle book page. Ex: on the kindle if the font is larger, you may click through 2-4 screens until you are officially off page 140 and moving onto 141. So I make my font size smaller, just personal preference! I immediately put a case on mine due to reviews saying it scratched easily. I bought one that had automatic “sleep mode” when it closed & it works perfect (only $10-$15). I have no complaints, I still love my paper back books but this has saved me so much money & I’ve read way more than I did with paper books!
The Kindle Paper white is soooo awesome!! No glare, light weight and easy to charge and travel with! Can’t go wrong with this at all!!
I bought this for my wife who was having trouble holding books and heavier readers. It has a long battery life and is easy to use.

I traded in my old Kindle because it wasn't holding a charge as well as it used to do. The new Kindle is a little bit smaller, but is otherwise pretty much the same as what I'm used to. I've been using Kindles for years now and recommend this model because it's the least expensive one and works like a charm.
Bought a new reader after having my original one for over 13 years.  Time for an upgrade.  Love the size of this one and the ease in operating.  No more pushing the page turner. 😊
It’s amazing Of course I would’ve preferred the paper white simply because the lighting on this one gives me a bit of a headache but it’s to me my baby it’s smaller funsized basically and I love it
I was interested in a paperwhite to keep the same screen feel as the voyage, but this kindle is the perfect fit in my hand. I always felt that the voyage was a tiny bit bigger than i’d like.

And she loved it. I was a little iffy cuz I knew she wanted to read but she doesn’t like using excessive technology for everyday things. This is a good compromise. It’s a device for a very specific reason, reading. And the battery lasts forever.
Much easier to hold than the previous larger one. (I wear a women's size 8 glove, so my hands are average.) Expect the battery life to be as good as my previous 4. Light as a feather, almost!

So I work for a rural ems agency and this was the best cure for boredom between calls on 24h shifts plus it fits in all the pockets on the 5.11 pants so you can take it with you on calls and when youer partner goes inside a store,restaurant, somewhere to pay bills etc you have more to do than watch tiktok

reviewTitle: Very happy with this Kindle ereader.
reviewDescription: I upgraded to this from an approximately ten year old Paperwhite. It still worked (held battery, turned on, could open books), but was extremely slow and somewhat unresponsive. This Kindle is definitely an improvement in pretty much every way. I like the dark mode feature that my previous Kindle didn't offer, as well as the fact that the software can receive updates and access the store, which my other couldn't because it was so old. I haven't tried the bluetooth function yet, but I can see that being nice in combination with Audible. It seems like a sturdy device, it should last a long time like my last one.

I started off a older generation Kindle and have wanted to upgrade for a while but didn't want just another tablet, so I decided on this one. It has not let me down! I love that it's still the grey scale like my old one but that it has a backlight so I can read in the dark! This thing is beyond what I expected! I love it!

NOTE FOLLOW UP EDIT AFTER BELOW REVIEWI wanted to like this device after reading the reviews.  I dropped my Fire HD 8 (10th gen) and the screen cracked down the middle but it is still very readable.  It is a fairly heavy device with the kickstand cover on it, so poked around to see what I could replace it with—since I really don’t tap into all of its computing power and apps.  I was intrigued by a lighter device that would also be readable outdoors in the sun.  I’m afraid, however, that this Kindle Basic is just too basic.  My primary source of reading material is the library. Overdrive was my download platform, and then my library switched to Libby. You cannot download either of these apps to the 11th gen Basic. In fact, you cannot download any apps, and the web browsing experience is dreadful. If latency and stuttering bother you, you will hate this.  So in order to download from the library you have to use another device and then point that device to this device to download the book. Not a huge hassle, but having all of your interactivity on a single device is where I want to be. Regarding the performance of the Basic:  the page turns are definitely not as quick and crisp as the Fire. It is slower, and there is a tad bit of latency.  If you read at night next to your significant other, the “Dark Mode” on this device is more gray than it is black. Definitely inferior to the blacks that Fire offers.  If you enjoy seeing the the full color covers of the books you read—you won’t be doing that here.  Finally, the size is just too small for my liking. Why not just read on your phone if this is the size you are looking for?  Lastly, I don’t trust all of the reviews boasting about battery life. Mine arrived at 53%, and by the time I was done with Amazon Kindle Support on the phone to confirm the web and app limitations the battery was down to 43% after also running a book download experiment by installing the Libby app on my phone and pointing the download at the new Basic. The Basic is now back in its shipping box with the return label attached and ready for a drop off at UPS.********Follow up:I have received my new Fire 7 (see picture above) and have achieved all of the goals I set out to accomplish.  The photo compares it to my Fire 8 HD (with a vertically cracked screen that you can’t really see).  Initially I had the 8HD for traveling and downloading movies. I don’t do much traveling anymore, but if I want to download content, I figured I can just use my MacBook with Retina screen for that.  And besides, all of the reviews for the Fire 7 say it is hard to tell that there is no HD since it is a small screen experience that you are only 2-3 feet away from. I don’t disagree. The great news is that without HD there is not as much processing speed required, so you end up with a MUCH lighter devise. As an ebook reader the performance mirrors the 8HD: crisp precise page turns, etc.  As you can see in the photo, the white background, however, is a little warmer, which I don’t mind at all. The morié effect on the Fire 7 pic is just a byproduct of the photo, and it does not look distorted in real life.  The weight of the Fire 7 and the cover with kickstand and hand strap that I have ordered is just over 15oz, which is just under 1 lb.—the weight of the average hardback.  Perfect.  Smaller and more manageable, lighter, excellent performance, the ability to download apps, a good web browser, ability to download content up to 16GB, and MUCH CHEAPER than the Basic Kindle.  The only thing that Basic Kindle will do better is allow you to read in direct sunlight—which I rarely do anyway since I am usually active when in direct sunlight.  5 stars for the Kindle Fire 7.

This was not my first Kindle - so I am well acquainted with them.  I noticed with a previous Kindle that even though the charging cables are USB - if you did not use the provided plug - they would have issues charging.  I had hoped that they had fixed that issue - but apparently not only did they not fix it - but now it is worse.  This Kindle was a gift for my wife - and she has had it since Mid- September 2023 - so 6 months.  A little over a month ago she was using it and the battery died - and of course we couldn't initially find the charging cable or plug - and of the 50 other USB cables we have and dozens of USB plugs - none of them would charge it.  So I tried to contact Amazon support to find out what the problem was.  I spent over an hour trying to get to chat with someone and kept ending up at "sorry page does not exist" errors.  Which is when I remembered the issue I had with an old Kindle with the charger.  So we searched the house until we found the plug and cable that came with it - and of course they didn't work either.  My wife even went online trying to figure out how to get it work - and she found dozens if not hundreds of complaints about the exact same problem.  I guess you can't count on Amazon to stand behind their products anymore.  If you love to read - get a non-Amazon tablet - and just download the Kindle app and use it that way - at least you'll have a functional tablet!

I realize this is a bare minimum product. I knew this when I purchased it. However, when I received this kindle, it came in the usual brown box with the standard air bags for protection. Inside though, the product was in a simple flimsy box with no padding. Nothing was included except the product and a very short charge cord. Now, I remember in the past Amazon used to include a few accessories with their products (cheaply made though they were), at the very least a charging brick and cord.  Amazon also took care with their packaging. Now it is only the product and a tiny charge cord in a box that was even slightly open at the top. I understand that things aren't the same as they used to be and that change happens. But this kindle was $99. $99 is a significant amount of money, and for me this purchase caused me to be in a hard place financially. My reason for purchasing in the first place was because I wanted to be able to read without notifications, which I can't do on my phone. This purchase was made so that I had something to occupy myself that wasn't mindless social media scrolling or interrupted reading. This purchase was made to help me ultimately have better mental health (mental health is extremely valuable to me, which is why i made the purchase even at the $99 price tag) and I feel for the sacrifice I made financially I did not get my monies worth. Not only did the product come with no accessories and flimsy packaging, it updated slowly and the scrolling and button pressing lagged. Like I'd press a button and nothing would happen for 5 seconds or longer. The first time I logged into my account on the kindle it failed to even load the book covers and I had to restart it to get it to display on my carousel. I did know it didn't have color, but I feel for $99 it should have been in color. Also, WHY are we paying to have no adds on our lock screen? (I did not end up paying for this but the fact I can't have a device without adds or notifications is INSANE) it's ridiculous. You wouldn't have adds on your phone or laptop screen that you have to pay extra to take off. I understand there is some marketing reason behind the adds but....wtf happened to quality?! I have been very disappointed with Amazon lately and if at all possible, I won't be lining their pockets when I can avoid it. For those wondering, yes, I can read my books, BUT, it is very slow and laggy and since there is no color, comics are off the table as I want color in my comics. I would have been happy with my purchase if it had been $50 cheaper. I feel ripped off!

reviewTitle: Worst experience with an E-reader I've ever had, somehow
reviewDescription: I've used several E-readers from several different companies, preferring to use them since I don't like just unilaterally supporting only amazon and instead giving competitors a chance. I've had varying experiences, and to be honest quite a number of them were bad. Somehow the original kindle tops, or maybe I should say bottoms all of them.- Not easy to read. Had to look up a youtube video to figure out how to exit a book.- Can't turn it off. No, seriously, it doesn't turn off even when you hold down the power button. Closest you get is "sleep" which isn't the same thing. It is designed to not ever turn off.- More of a website issue, but the sleeve advertised to come with it did not fit.- It has ads.- IT HAS ADS.Note on that last bit, I didn't pay partial price, or installments. I paid for the full price of the product up front, and the books I got for it. And they want to charge me extra to remove ads. This is how they treat paying customers now?Not only am I not going to pay AGAIN to remove ads, I'm refunding this product because of that. If you payed for the ads to be removed you are enabling Amazon to treat you like this. Don't let yourself get treated this badly, bite the bullet and buy from their competitors like I will be shortly.

reviewTitle: Exchanged twice and all 3 Kindles skipped. This is trash!
reviewDescription: I’ve had a few Kindles over the years. All have been great. I love that they finally added dark mode to this new Kindle. For me, it’s so much easier on my eyes. I love to read while in bed or in a dark room so the darker screen is so much better than the bright white. My 2 complaints about this Kindle are that every so often.. maybe every 5-10 page turns. It will page ahead 2 pages instead of 1. Also every so often it will for a second flash the white screen when changing pages if it’s on dark mode. If these two minor flaws were fixed, I’d say that this is a near perfect Kindle. The battery lasts forever! I read sometimes all day long and it barely puts a dent in the battery percentage.***** UPDATE***. Ok so I’ve had to return this twice now and have gotten replacements. The first Kindle I had was skipping all the time making it impossible to read.  So they replaced it with no issue. The 2nd one started out pretty good. Was only skipping occasionally at first but then started getting worse and skipping more often to the point that in a half hour time it skipped 4 times and one of those times it skipped several pages ahead.  So I contacted customer service again and at first they said I could not replace this again or get a refund.  I told them that was unacceptable since this hasn’t even been 5 months into the year warranty. So they sent me a 3rd one.  I just got it yesterday and so far, fingers crossed, it’s perfect.  I read for a bit last night before going to bed and have been reading for about an hour this morning and so far not a single skip.  I charged it up before I went to bed and was shocked at how fast it charged and so far today the charge is holding.  So there shouldn’t be any problems there.  The only thing tho that really makes me mad during this process of this whole Kindle situation is that the last 2 Kindles they sent me were refurbished ones and not new ones.  I originally purchased a new kindle and therefore it should be replaced with a new one.  I did not originally buy a refurbished Kindle.  But if this one keeps working as wonderfully as it has been so far, I’ll be happy.Another Update**** 2nd replacement/3rd Kindle also skips pages… I give up and I’m sure I won’t be able to return for a refund. My older 2019 Kindle works better than this so I’ll just use that one and this one will sit on my bookshelf collecting dust. I don’t even want to sell it because that isn’t fair to the next person either. Don’t waste your money on this Kindle!!!! It’s trash!!!!

reviewTitle: Another Kindle product hits the dust.
reviewDescription: I haven't owned this Kindle for even a month and within the last few weeks it started doing something that none of the other kindles had ever done.  I would read through 25% to 60% of a book and it would stop any forward progression of the story and went directly to the rating page at the end of the book.  It would not allow me to go to the next page of the story but defaulted to the rating page/end of the book. It would not even go to the next chapter.  I tried rebooting the kindle and several times changed authors to make sure it wasn't a glitch in the actual book but it continued.  I started and returned over 4 books from my Kindle unlimited because I couldn't finish them.I tried returning the kindle through the normal return process and was told I must contact customer service. I spoke with an  Amazon representative by phone who handled the situation very effectively and got my return through.  I even purchased insurance on the kindle I am returning because of having so many issues with these products in the past.  I am sure I will need to change the coverage to this model, which I will once I receive it.I have read where other people have replaced their kindle with other readers and were very happy.  I keep thinking that the problems/quality control issues will be fixed as new models come out but apparently is a chronic issue with some of these devices.  I take full responsibility for continuing to purchase these devices in the hopes that they have improved the technology each year, but still remain disappointed that has not happened.If this new kindle starts acting up I will return it and find another brand of reader to replace it.  I still have my Iphone which has never given me a problem or issues with the quality of the book, frozen screens, white screens or slow WIFI  issues with the kindle app unlimited or books I have purchased to read.If I could make any suggestions regarding the production of these Kindle readers would be to hire some  people who can determine if there are quality control issues before the product is released instead of playing catch and having negative reviews.

reviewTitle: New interface is too awful for me to use; I will carry a power bank & stick with Voyage
reviewDescription: I didn't really want to replace my Kindle Voyage, which has worked very well for me for many years, but its battery is no longer fully reliable and it crashed (required reboot) a few times on my last trip so I was complaining about it. The new 2022 Kindle was a gift from my husband who heard my grumbling from the adjacent seat.Today, I opened the box and powered on the Kindle 2022, only to discover some hateful interface designer thinks ENORMOUS thumbnail images are better than seeing more list items on a single page. I disagree, and will not keep this device if it prioritizes images over words, and showing more Amazon sales prompts over making reading a seamless, pleasant experience.I use my Kindle every day, and often for hours at a time. If the interface is bad, I'll carry a power bank and stick with my old Voyage if I can't find somewhere online to get a battery replacement (or a new-to-me additional Voyage in better condition.)I can't evaluate the Battery Life for this review as I don't think I'll have this device long enough to discover whether the hardware itself is any good.The touchscreen seems responsive, but I was very reluctant to give up my physical page turn buttons for this new model anyway, so I'm not the best judge for this feature.I was so excited by this gift, and now I'm utterly disappointed. My husband found people online discussing how to jailbreak the device to go back to old software. I don't want to do that. Amazon has done enough things right with the Kindle reading ecosystem that I was willing to stick with it. If they move away from e-readers as devices FOR PEOPLE WHO LOVE WORDS, they will lose my e-book business.Everyone who hates the new list interface must visit customer service and report it. Hopefully someone will listen. Keep the people who love pictures designing book covers, and ask actual readers what they value in a "List View" of their library. I'd guess most of us prefer to see the TITLE and AUTHOR in a clear font, ideally with an adjustable size as we can do inside the book reading view.Personally, I want to view as many titles per page as possible in my chosen font size! Seeing four titles per page makes it more difficult to find what I want if I'm browsing by flicking through the list, and it doesn't even allow me to see just those volumes I'm actively reading at one time. (I tend to keep 5-6 books in active rotation at any given time.)Epic fail on the latest Kindle interface.

I am a traditional reader; hard cover and paperback books. As much as I prefer these it becomes astorage issue when the collection reaches hundreds and more.I have owned three Kindles. I purchased this model in June 2023. I was reading the fifth book from Kindle Unlimited when things went haywire about four chapters in. It wouldn’t swipe to the next page and instead changed to the top of the screen asking me to rate the book “ before you go.” I bypassed this by clicking on the X at the top. It returned to book, but at a location that made nosense in the flow of the story. This happenedmany times. I turned it off thinking it may reset.Eventually it completely obliterated everything I had stored which included about 50-70 books transferred from my last Kindle. I now have a blank bright white page.I know this is the smallest, least expensive Kindle; the exact reason I bought it. I am left with no choice other than buying another one with the hope that it will retrieve my collection and lastmore than six months!Shame on you Amazon!

reviewTitle: Not Free Audible Audiobooks from Audible Plus Subscription on this device.
reviewDescription: I bought this Kindle because I was told I could listen to audible books via bluetooth speaker, headphones or ear buds. You can do that but you have to pay full price for the book. Your Audible Plus is worthless. You can cut the audible version for the same price without the membership.  Talked to Customer Support and was told I had to download the Audible App or have Whisper Sync. Neither are available for this device. This is just an ordinary Kindle with a premium price. Both of my other three Kindles will let me read the books in my library. This one will do the same. I can read my audible books for free, but not listen to them without a payment of over $22 for one book and $7 for the other of the two I tested.  Do not accept their assurance that you can listen to your audible plus membership books for free on this device. You will have to pay.  I can't believe I can listen to the books for free on my phone, my laptop or my tablet but not on a device made by the same company that sells the membership.

I bought this unit to replace my 2017 Kindle.  Nothing wrong with the old unit, I just wanted something newer.  Big Mistake.Amazon has totally changed the menu system, and in my opinion for the worse.  Instead of a simple text-based system the menus now show book covers.  And there is only one line of covers for books I have bought, and multiple lines of books Amazon is trying to sell me.Further, under the old system I could remove a book from the Kindle and keep it in the cloud.  Now, if I 'delete the download' the book cover remains on the Kindle taking up space.  If I want to delete the cover I have to delete the book from the cloud which means if I ever want to go back to the book I have to buy it again.  Why, Amazon, WHY?Amazon, you took something simple, functional, and beautiful and turned it into yet another ugly, confusing marketing scheme.  I still have not found a good explanation of the difference between the "Home" and "Library" sections....I haven't decided whether to return the Kindle.  If there is a way to return to the old menu style, please tell me.  I will be a happy customer then.January 2023 Update: I continue to dislike the new menu system.  It seems to be all about proposing new titles AND, above all, saving web space.  In the old system if I bought a book I downloaded it, read it, then deleted from kindle.  However, upon deleting from Kindle a copy of the book was kept in my cloud account.  Now, that copy is no longer saved and should I want to re-read the book I would have to buy it again.  Great marketing strategy but as usual the customer is the one who loses.

I already like this so much better than the paperwhite that I had. The screen size difference is not really noticable. This one has pretty much everything the paperwhite had- even a dark mode. Not sure if it is waterproof, but I always play it safe and put my devices in a ziplock bag if they might get wet anyway. The touch screen still works just fine with plastic over it. Presto! A waterproof case for pennies. I like the slim design and the screen, in my opinion, is actually better than my old paperwhite. I was also able to use my old finitie cases for this kindle too. I just cut a thin strip of the insert foam it came with for the top and one side and it fits perfectly. The case's magnet on/off doesn't work tho. But I can live with that.

reviewTitle: Pocket Sized Portal to Other Worlds
reviewDescription: This review is for the 6” Kindle Basic from 2022. This is the first kindle/ereader/eink device I’ve ever owned. I was skeptical at first, as I’ve typically been a die hard physical book reader. Growing up in the late 80’s, early 90’s, physical books were all that existed, so it would stand to reason I would have gazed upon ereaders with a bit of haughtiness. Besides, I have a smartphone, and after having tried reading via the kindle app and disliking it, I had sworn off ebooks for good, or so I thought. However, after taking the plunge and gazing upon the sharp text on the grey eink screen and seeing how closely it resembles an actual paper page, my skepticism soon turned to delight.  Reading on a dedicated e-ink screen is vastly different from reading on a phone. If I’d have known that sooner, I may have been an ebook convert long ago. The refresh rate of a kindle screen is far slower than that of a smartphone, pc, or tablet, with evidence potentially pointing to this, and the blue-light factor, as being a couple of reasons people get headaches after staring at these screens for awhile. The lights of the kindle screen point inward towards the text, rather than coming from behind the screen as on a smartphone, this means that, when reading at night, it’s far less bright and easier on the eyes.  I’m now obsessed with this device, I’ve only had it a few weeks, but in that time I’ve either been reading it, or loading books onto it. Kindle is a supremely apt name because this 6” pocket sized portal to another world has rekindled the intense reading passion of my youth, to the point I’m looking up and reading public domain classics I barely glanced at in the past. I’ve now installed over 91 books onto the device, and with 16 gigs of memory, it seems I’ll likely have room for more books than I could read in the rest of my lifetime.The height of the device is actually slightly shorter than that of my iPhone 11 Pro Max, but about an inch wider. This means I can easily slip the device in and out of my pocket, though it takes up basically the entire width of whatever pocket in goes in, pantswise. I’ve got a flip cover case on the way in order to protect the screen, as eink screens and cells are more fragile than phone screens, and I also like the idea of waking and sleeping the screen just with the flap, rather than the annoyingly placed sleep button.  Overall, if anyone is debating on whether or not to pick up one of these, or whether you’ll like it as opposed to physical books, debate no more! If you’re a reader, or thinking about getting into reading, or you struggle with storing or carrying your books places, this is the device for you. Making the transition to reading on an eink screen is easier than you think, and the storage space and small form factor will leave you never wanting for any books in your collection when you travel, ever again. So just pull the trigger and get it already!

I've had the old Kindle Touch (4th Generation) for many years.  I've used it quite a when I first got it, but over the years, started using my iPad, especially when I'm traveling so that I can carry less devices.  Recently I started reading more again and realized I should use my Kindle again to save battery on my iPad.  However, I started noticing the age of my old Kindle and decide to upgrade to the latest.I got this basic Kindle over the paperwhite because I wanted to smallest, lightest one available.  I also got the case and it was still much lighter and smaller than my old one.  The best part is that it response so much faster than the old device.  It also reminds me how much enjoyable and easier on the eyes it is to read on a Kindle vs. the iPad.So happy I upgraded.

I've had a kindle for about 10 years now. After a lot of use, I wanted to upgrade to one that had backlight and touchscreen. This is the one I chose and it has been great. I've read a few books and pdfs in this, and I can say it is a lot easier to use than the one I had before. I like how easy it is to highlight phrases, to look at the meaning of unknown words and to go back and forth between pages. The one thing I'm not a fan of is the paging system because I can't make easy parallels with physical books, but I understand the reasoning behind it, and it's something I'll get used to.

reviewTitle: One of my favorite purchases in a long time.
reviewDescription: One of my favorite purchases. I’ve grown used to reading on my phone (i read fanfiction as well as published books) and find I much prefer e-reading to reading a physical book (I know I’m in the minority here. Everything about this kindle is perfect. It’s compact and fits perfectly in jacket pockets or my brixley bag when I’m on the go. It’s lightweight. The backlight and dark mode features are wonderful. The price wasn’t too steep. I read far more now than I have in years. Highly recommend.

I finally gave in and bought one, and it is a game changer for me because I travel so much, and I can't take 10 books with me because there is simply no room. So this allows me to download and read on the go without the hassle of carrying heavy physical books that take up room. Overall, I love the practicality of having a Kindle that is smaller than a book and can have as many books on it as I please!

My daughter is still figuring out what she likes to read and instead of buying ten different books and her not liking any of them, we opted to go with a kindle & kindle unlimited so she could ultimately find something she likes without breaking the bank.  She loves how easy it is to use, how small it is to carry with her, and how long the battery life is.

I hardly ever have to charge my kindle, battery life last a long time. The size was perfect, it fits in my little purse. It’s not heavy so I always have it with me. I also got the Amazon kindle membership and have had access to soooooo many amazing free books! I recommend getting the membership with the kindle.

Bought this for my daughter who is a surgical neuro physiologist.  When she has downtime at work, she can pull this out and read a little of her latest book.  Very easy to slip into a small bag.  Very lightweight and easy to use.  Wasn't sure if she would get enough use out of it, but she has told me that it is the favorite (and most used) gift from this past year.  Was surprised by how inexpensive it was.

I have resisted an ereader for years, convinced I would hate it because I love physical books so much. The smell, turning the pages, etc. Well. I received this for Christmas, and I have read over a dozen books on it since then. In the year prior, I read two physical books. I absolutely love it. The size is great, it’s so lightweight, I like the brightness adjustability and font options. I love how it’s so portable. I take it with me while I wait in the school pickup line, and it takes close to zero space in my bag. I love that I can read library books and not have to drive nearly an hour round trip to check one out and return it. I can lay in bed and do it all, sloth mode activated lol. If you’re on the fence about a Kindle, I’d encourage you to give it a try. I’m so thankful I have mine, it’s been such a great little tool to rekindle (no pun intended) my love of reading :)

reviewTitle: Small, tiny… not what I expected
reviewDescription: It’s a kindle so review is only 4 stars because damnnnn this thing isn’t much bigger than my phone! Disappointed in the size. Gave the 4 stars because it works great and has better features… can you make one that’s the size of your 5th generation ?? Honestly, not much bigger than my phone. :/
Good to read with but a little too small for a man.

reviewTitle: Second eReader that will not Charge or Operate / Amazon Support is NonExistent
reviewDescription: Bought this as a gift for my daughter.  First device quit / died within two weeks, returned for replacement.  This one lasted another 11 months, but same issue, will not charge or turn on.  Tried multiple cables / chargers and all of the support recommendations.  Updated - I was able to find a Phone Number on the internet and actually got through to support and will receive another replacement.  Updated review from 1 star to 4 stars.

This is my third Kindle. So you know that I love the product. But, the description of the new Kindle said that this new product would hold its charge for up to 6 weeks. This is a brand new product and it didn't even hold a charge for a week. I'm disappointed in the diminished charge time.

reviewTitle: Love this, but paid extra for free kindle unlimited and didn't get it
reviewDescription: I love kindle e-readers, so small to carry around and easy to use. I was frustrated though that I specifically chose the option for 3 months of free kindle unlimited and I was not given any option to activate it when setting up the device. I reached out to customer service and there was nothing they could do to activate three months for me. Don't expect that you will get some free kindle unlimited.

reviewTitle: Do not pair Kindle Unlimited if there is any chance you may need to cancel the order
reviewDescription: Kindles are great. However, I decided to change to the paperwhite and tried to cancel this one since I ordered that. Even with customer service and already having Kindle Unlimited previously, it cannot be unpaired and thw Kindle cannot be cancelled. This is even when it won't be shipped for several more days.

reviewTitle: Recommend for a lower-cost reading experience!
reviewDescription: I’ve been anti-Kindle since they first came out, because I've always been so extremely loyal to physical books. When this was on sale for October prime day, I decided to take the plunge and purchase one. Therefore, this is my first official E-reader.Things I love about the e-reader switch:My library is all loaded onto one simple, lightweight device. I tend to burn through books very quickly, and it is great to be able to do that without paying $10-$25 for a hard copy of one. I no longer am burdened with an ever-growing library of physical books that are a pain to move between apartments, and it is very travel-friendly in general. The screen doesn’t hurt my eyes like I expected it to. It is far easier to hold in my hand than a physical book is. The battery life seems great. I like that there are no distractions when I read, and the interface is very user-friendly. I love the anti-glare. I far prefer reading on this unique device over reading on my iPad.Things I miss about physical books:I do miss the smell of the pages of a physical book. I miss being able to seamlessly flip through pages, or look at the entirety of two pages at once. I hate having to charge a device to read (though this is not a huge deal since the battery life is so excellent). The ads on the front are extremely annoying. It sometimes seems glitchy/slow when flipping pages. Sometimes the book covers are hard to see.Overall, I love this device and I will certainly get a ton of use out of it. The positives outweigh the negatives. I feel no desire to upgrade to a “nicer” Kindle anytime soon. I will likely still occasionally buy physical books.

So far this unit is just okay. My previous Kindle was a 10 y.o. 6th gen and battery life was great until the past year. (Also, it tended to crash pretty frequently.) The plastic of this new unit feels more slippery and the battery is only lasting 2 weeks (even in airplane mode) but the Kindle Paperwhite will still always be my favorite e-reader. I'll get used to it I suppose.

ProsPerfect size for one handed reading (important for me as I do most reading lying down in bed). It’s what drew me to this version rather than the slightly larger Paperwhite.Adjustments for font and brightness make it easy to read anytime, anywhere.No screen glare.Never need a book light.Extremely portable. Take as many books as I want wherever I go and it fits in the smallest pocket of my bag? Yes please!ConsResponse time a bit slow when scrolling through library or kindle store- recommend doing this part on your phone when possible. For me this was not a deal breaker.Battery does NOT last weeks. One full charge lasted me about 6 days, on average I use mine about 3 hours a day. This is not a big deal unless you won’t be near a charger for days at a time.Device feels fragile without a case, the shell is not tacky so it’s easy to drop. I thinks case is necessary. Luckily there are a lot of great cases online. Mine has a hand strap and kickstand.This kindle is a true basic e-reader. No bells and whistles, just a portable, reliable, easy to use digital library. It’s exactly what I was looking for.

I am mostly happy with this. I downgraded from an Oasis; I wanted the smaller size. It is indeed more comfortable in the hand. I use this daily and am content.However, there are  things that do not live up to what this kindle is supposedly capable of:1. It will never download my whole library. When it gets too many books on it, my only choice is to do a factory reset.*The first sign of trouble is when I cannot download the book from the kindle device. Then I have to go to My Content and Devices on my Amazon account web page to send the book to kindle. At some point,  it cannot deliver a book.Then the helpful tech support people will tell you to do a factory reset. You will erase all content, of course, and then it will need to do any upgrades from 2022 (in my case) when it was first released.Note: I've never gotten 1,000 books on any kindle without this happening2. If you have a lot of books, it is not able to organize your books by series. The apps on my iPhone and iPad organize them fine, but no longer on my kindle device.What does this mean?Don't spend extra money getting more storage. I never came close to using the 32Gb on the Oasis, and I still have over 11Gb free on this kindle. It doesn't matter: I will have to perform a factory reset long before I come close.*I currently have 842 books downloaded; I own over 8000

This was a big disappointment for me. I had a 2012-era Kindle for 13 years. It was very easy to read that book. This new Kindle was extremely difficult to navigate. Just the other day, I was reading my new book, and it suddenly jumped ahead 15 pages without my prompt. It took me 20 minutes just to figure out how to get back to my page. You have to swipe left to right to go backwards...and right to left to go forward. This is backwards!! And if I finished one page, I have to press it just right just to go ahead to the next page! I know I will have to spend another 20-30 minutes just to get to the Home page or my library. Finally, Steve Jobs, the founder of Apple, would have fired the engineers who designed this lemon of a product!!

This was a big mistake. There are good things that this thing makes you want to have, but does not deliver. A tablet whether Kindle Fire or any other tablet is SO MUCH BETTER with so many more features, accessibility, that this thing leaves you wishing you had. This feels like wasted $ to me, as I can NEVER be satisfied with this. I need to be able to access books from other places than just Amazon and this CANNOT do it! Disappointed I didn't get Amazon Fire for a little more or even any tablet, but I had no idea. Hopefully this helps others to make better choice.

This is about my 12th or 13th kindle, it is of the poorest quality of any that I have ever had. It doesn't hold a charge,  downloads take forever, currently the screen is frozen and will not clear or move on to another task. I don't think I should have to purchase 2 kindles in 1 year.  I do read a great deal. I do have many books in my archive, but not enough to bog down the whole system. I should probably speak with customer care about replacing this defective product.

Amazon HAS to start thinking of protecting the planet. They had enough time to figure out new, environmentally safe and efficient ways of delivering items purchased from the Amazon website. As seen in the attached photo, the Kindle reader is small enough that it can move in the cavernous box when it is being shipped & delivered.I’ve started using the reader and it’s interesting. I’ll probably post a follow up review in about 3 months.

If I had realized this doesn’t allow continuous scrolling I wouldn’t have purchased it. Not sure why they make it available on the mobile app but not the actual Kindle, makes 0 sense. The screen also appears to show the imprint of text that’s no longer there and it is very slow. I also wish the touch screen was more sensitive.

Be aware you’re buying a billboard (ads always on) which will flash bright light in dark mode every time you turn a page. It’s super easy to accidentally jump ahead or back number of pages.It’s small (maybe too small) and light weight and holds a charge for a long time.Can I return it if I don’t still have the packaging?

Don’t like it at all! I am not sure if I got a one with defects. It is very difficult to turn the screen off and the screen  will never ever turn itself off in its inactive mode like all other electric devices do until the active screen runny out of battery. I am not going to say it is a piece a junk; but it is really not a great thing. Stay away from it and there are better ones.
kindles are great  this design is horrible  i literally hate it

I bought this new kindle since my other one started skipping pages.  Well my new one is way worse.  I spend all my time back tracking.  Sometimes it jumps several pages and I’m so frustrated.  My old ones never did thus why is my new one worse?  Signed very very frustrated.

It goes back several pages while I am reading and I have to flip thru to find my place and start over. My books didn't transfer and had to uninstall and reinstall! It doesn't sync with my fire tablet I have to open my fire tablet to see where I am and flip the pages to get to the right page! Not user friendly as the fire tablet to get to pages quickly! Will probably return! I'm going to reset first!
Had a different kindle was about 15 years old and wanted the back light. Alot smaller than the other but very nice. Will enjoy for sure
Got this for her as a gift. She loves it! She loves to read and this was perfect. It’s very small and light that she brings it with her every where in her purse. Good buy!

This was a surprise birthday gift.  She reads all the time.  I was concerned the size of the screen was smaller than I had envisioned.  Short story is she absolutely loves it and is never without a great book to read.  Keeps a charge and charges quickly.  Very clear print and she loves the size of the screen.  Nothing but positives for the Kindle and she has unlimited which is also very nice.
I use this kindle while I work...I use the bluetooth feature to listen to books while I work in my studio! It's great.
I can now read whenever I want to… I take my kindle with me everywhere… don’t mind having to wait for things now

Este kindle a mi parecer no tiene nada que envidiarle a los modelos mas avanzados, sirve para lo que fue destinado, se puede leer al aire libre ya que  la pantalla no genera ningún brillo y en la noche la luz es super amigable con los ojos.Adicional, la función de buscar palabras desconocidas con el diccionario y wikipedia es super practico y la posibilidad de subrayar y tomar notas le da un toque mas personal a las lecturas.
I’ve had mine for two days, and have not been able to get off of it! Size comparison is a standard Sussex hen.

I had the kindle e-ink 4th generation years ago.  I loved it, but lost it while moving.  I've had the kindle fire which I still love.  Nothing will compare to the original kindle e-reader and I love that it now comes with a backlight I can turn on or off.  Also bought the beautiful case for it with my favorite artwork ( starry night) which is awesome for propping it up or the handle to hold it without dropping it.  Light weight, small and easy to carry along.  Absolutely love it!!!
I purchased for my daughter who loves to read. The tablet has a paper like feel and a dimmer light, so it’s like you’re reading a real book.I love that idea for true book loversMy daughter loves it.

reviewTitle: Love it!  Compact and still good quality!
reviewDescription: Only two problems!  Time is not at the top of the page you’re reading! You have to tap the top and bring down the control page!  And there is no charged light. The old one told me with a yellowLight that it was charging & the green light came on when it was totally charged!!  I miss that!

This is my 4th? Paperwhite and it's absolutely the worst.  In addition to the sluggishness associated with the kindle software in general, it randomly pops down the top menu and freezes for several seconds, it flips the bookmark tab down for no apparent reason, and it occasionally jumps back or forward several pages. But the absolutely most annoying bug is that it usually takes 3+ touches to turn a page and those touches aren't always in the same place.  Each time I get a new Paperwhite,  I've hoped that the sluggish response will be improved although that hasn't really happened.  This time though, there is NO PROGRESS whatsoever;  quality is going in reverse!  If they weren't more comfortable on my eyes, I would never get another one.

I returned it because it would not turn on.  I expected it to be like my other Kindle Paperwhite already loaded with my existing program and library.  I did NOT want to spend 2 hours on the phone while they had me trouble shoot.  I wanted to turn it on and seamlessly move to this new device.  Did not even turn on even after charged.

Item is completely frozen after only a year of working perfectly! Tried all the amazon forum recommended tricks. Nothing works, can't reset, can't restart. Should be able to get a replacement but Amazon wants me to fix it myself. I tried fixing it myself but still frozen. Should be replaced by Amazon.

reviewTitle: Vastly inferior to the Kindle I got in 2011
reviewDescription: This product lacks the features my very first Kindle had back in 2012.  I have to push and then swipe simply to open the book I was reading.  Once I have finished a book it is very difficult to return to my library and none of the touch controls are intuitive or easy to understand.  This is a horrible product absolute trash don't buy it

Do NOT, I repeat do NOT link the kindle to your account if you are sending it is a gift. If you choose the kindle WITH 3 months unlimited please for the love of Gawd, uncheck the link to account for easy setup. the subscription will NOT follow the kindle, will be added to your account and it is IMPOSSIBLE to get back the 3 months.I have spent over 1hr and 30 minutes trying to get this resolved and just hung up in pure and utter frustration.BTW, it was a gift for my wife...i assumed the Kindle Unlimited was linked to household accounts just like music and videos, but it is not. So be alert and make sure that little box is NOT checked.

reviewTitle: Skip to the end of the book in the middle of the book
reviewDescription: I bought both this and a paperwhite to replace my old voyager and they’re both crap my voyager which is several years old is better than the both of these put together I’ll be in the middle of a book like 20% in a book I paid for and it’ll just suddenly skip to the end of the book the entire meat of the book is missing my voyager never did that still doesn’t do it so I bought two Kindles and neither one works correctly. And yes I tried to update it still didn’t work tried to reset it still didn’t work I don’t know what the software is that you put into these new kindles but it’s crap.

reviewTitle: Hate this new model, extended battery life advert not true
reviewDescription: Got this to replace my older model Paperwhite, but I went back to the older one. This new one uses a lot more battery power for me. At first, it used to blind me in the middle of the night when I open the cover to continue reading my book in progress. Even with the backlighting set to only 2 or 3 it still flashes a bright blinding light when you open the cover (or however you wake it up). I switched to Dark mode and that has kept me from getting the blinding flash of light, but the device still uses at least 3 or 4 times the amount of battery my older version Paperwhite does.

reviewTitle: Reader no longer has WSJ (or many other newspapers)
reviewDescription: Sole reason for buying it was to read my papers (WSJ and NH Union Leader). Multiple google searches and ChatGPT said these were supported. After receiving the device, we learned that WSJ was stopped in March 2023 and all others in September 2023. Unfortunate Amazon wants you to buy the Unlimited service but only has limited papers. Unless you get Bezos’ Washington Post you are out of luck!  Was looking forward to a reader that was easier on the eyes :-(

reviewTitle: My kindle is not functioning well.
reviewDescription: Bought this on July 26, 2023 and I cannot use it now because the screen is blank when opening. I want toask whether I can return the kindle and be replaced? Please advise what to do since  I have been using it for  almost 7 months  only and it seems the book is already out of order. Thank you.
It began with Moisture DETECTETED.  Now dead after less than 120 days. It was "waterproof".  Never immersed. Used frequently in sauna(high temperature low humidity).

Did kindle repackage the first paperwhite? I bought one and returned it because as I scroll the page blinks like it reloads every page so I turned that feature off and it still acts like it is reloading the page. Very annoying!!! It is black and white so boring and hard to find my books, I do not recommend terrible product.

I purchased the Kindle paperwhite in May 2023 for a planned vacation in September 2023.  The kindle worked for three months June-August.  While on vacation, the kindle screen froze.  I accessed support online, read the instructions and watched the videos.  None of the solutions worked. Due to the fact Amazon does not employ living humans for customer service, I am unable to file for a replacement even though the product is eligible through May 2024. Persons working at Amazon Hubs tell me to "conduct a product return online" otherwise they are unable to help. The website sends me on a wild goose chase of self help when I try to file for a replacement. This is an example where Amazon fails to provide both a quality product and a fails to follow through with promises to customers.  My advice-don't buy Amazon products.

I bought Amazon's refurbished/used.  It was well packaged, looked great, charged well, and the button worked and successfully connected to my WiFi.  But it never connected to my Amazon account.  I wasted two evenings searching online troubleshooting, then called the Amazon help chat.  They were very nice/efficient, but (after 45 minutes) they concluded that my device was "Deactivated"; they couldn't "Activate" it on their end; and there was no way for me to "Activate" it on my end.  Their only recommendation was to return it for a new one.  BUT WHY SHIP A PRODUCT TO A CUSTOMER IF IT'S JUST A BRICK?!?

reviewTitle: Finally bought one, waste of money
reviewDescription: I have been reading Kindle books on an old Kindle Fire and my Android phone and tablets. I finally splurged for a proper Kindle reader and the experience feels as if I went back to 1999...slow, clunky interface that takes a second to react, black and white, and several of my Kindle purchases won't load on the Kindle or the formatting is off and there are sections of pages missing. Sure the battery lasts a long time, even longer on mine because I rarely use it. The Kindle app for Android is not great by a mile but highly preferred over this retro Soviet-era tech wannabe.

It's a simple eReader, but somehow Amazon's greed for the almighty dollar has ruined this great product.  Gone is the traditional home screen, it now one big annoying mess.  Would you like to download 5 books and see them on your home screen?  Forget about it.  You'll need to search for them in your library.  Unfortunately, I sometimes don't remember the author or title and have hundreds of books in my library to search through.  The home screen is now how Amazon pushes books it wants you to read.  So if you like having Amazon leading you by the nose to the books they want you to read, then this product is for you.

Amazon sells junk.My old Paperwhite has no problem logging in when I'm traveling. This new Kindle has problems and so did the Kindle Fire I returned.Amazon claims "Extended battery life".  My old Paperwhite lasts longer between charges.I'm not looking forward to the day the Paperwhite gives up the ghost. Maybe I can find a used one w/ low miles bc new Kindles are junk. Fires are junk too.Junk

Amazon has to be kidding me. I purchased a kindle 4 days ago, the device will not hold a charge; I reach out for assistance and I’m told to send them my device and they’ll try to fix it within 5 days, and then if they can’t, send me a new device. WHAT? So I’m out of a device for 5+ days? Comical. Then they offer to send me a replacement right away, but I HAVE TO PAY 15%?! Most horrible resolution I have ever heard. I’ll be returning this defective item and purchasing an iPad. Apple would NEVER. DO BETTER AMAZON!!!!

My one and only Kindle was purchased when they were first released. In the last few months, I noticed that it had lived a long life and was beginning to show its age.  I thought I would get a new one and decided to get the new smaller Kindle.  Mistake.  It has not worked consistently since I got it, which was 4 months ago.  It wasn't charging consistently, or not charging at all.  I bought a new charger thinking my original one was not working correctly...wrong!  It still isn't charging and if I'm not using it, goes off and on consistently. Not what I expect from a Kindle. I am purchasing new Kindle like I had before.  It was wonderful and lasted for ever.  Regardless of this review, I can highly recommend another Kindle.  Quality, long lasting, consistent with no issues.  Do yourself a favor if you read a lot, get another Kindle.P.S.  I have just retired and now I can kick back in my favorite chair or out by the pool and read to my heart's content.

reviewTitle: battery completely dead after a month of not using
reviewDescription: I loved it when it worked but it won't recharge after 2 months of not using it.  No information on which battery it uses nor how to replace it.  Very disappointed.

reviewTitle: Impossible to remove book from device
reviewDescription: When reading a book, text disappears and is replaced by extraneous material. Do not buy.This is a follow-up. Previous problem was resolved after much effort by Tam R. (terrific lady). Now it is impossible to remove book(s) from device-no facility (forget web advice to contrary. Must access website and that does not work either. Spent over an hour with support with absolutely no success although they could remove books from their end. It seems as if I will have to spend an hour with support every time I wish to remove a book. Totally unacceptable with no benefit to user. Product was better in early days. Look for better alternative. PS I was told operating system is the same across all devices.

After my kindle fire from 2012 finally died it was time for a replacement. I ordered this Kindle because I only ever used my Fire for books, not as a tablet. I opened my new kindle and plugged it in because it had 48% battery. I went to work for the afternoon and came home 6 hours later and it was still at 48% battery. Obviously it wouldn't charge. I vouldnt get past the screen though. I really hated the paper like look. It was very glitchy because every time I pressed a button the screen would flicker the old image before landing on the new one. It was a major disappointment.  I immediately returned it and ordered  a new Fire 7.

I had a full charge on my Kindle, I have not read it for at least 5 days.I went to buy some Kindle books and my Kindle was dead.When I plugged it in, it had zero charge!!!Amazon, stop bragging about something that is a lie!

Everything I want to put on this thing is not supported. So, Amazon, I can't purchase any books because your paper white won't take them. What a rip off! Wish I hadn't bought it. Maybe I can put games on it? Ain't no good for books.

reviewTitle: I've Only Had it 3 Days & It Doesn't Work
reviewDescription: I just bought this kindle 3 days ago. When I received it, it was at 51% charge so I placed it on the charger. It charged up to 100% but the battery drains very quickly. It's supposed to last 6 weeks, but after a few days it's already down 22% in charge. That's not great.In addition, it's been freezing on me. I was trying to read something on it earlier and the screen would just go blank and I had to restart it to get it to function again. A few minutes after restarting, it went blank again. For a brand new product, it's been malfunctioning a great deal. I plan to return it.Update:Amazon sent me a replacement Kindle free of charge (but I had to advocate that it be free of charge because they tried to charge me a $15 replacement fee and I refused to pay it) and I returned the first one. The replacement had the same issues as the first (less than advertised battery life, screen freezing). I have decided to return the replacement and just get a refund as 2 for 2 in terms of lemon products is plain bad. I don't recommend this product.

reviewTitle: I wanted to love this. Would work great for basic reading
reviewDescription: I wanted to love this. I got it to read on. Several things that were deal breakers for me -•It was clunky loading right off the bat brand new. The screen flashed with almost every action•No navigation buttons. This results in touching around the screen•No apps except kindle built in. It does have a browser but it would not load even on good WIFI.•How drawn out it is to send books to the Kindle from my library's Libby app.  It didn't register that I had Kindle unlimited so I had to do this extra step to read for free.•The ads on the lock screen - now note, I knew about this when I bought it. It is worth spending the extra $20 to upgrade to your own book showing on the screen . However it's obnoxious that they charge for this feature. You're already sinking $100 + into a device. Why not just include it as a thank you?•Over sensitive light adjustment. I think this may be why the screen flashed so often -over compensating/adjusting for the light around me•Only Wifi. It wasn't very clear that it only came with WIFI but I should have read the fine print.Pros:This would work well if you don't mind the slower OS and just want the basic reading cabilities on it. The battery life is fantastic! It does have good storage on it.

reviewTitle: Trying to get subscription to Kindle Unlimited for granddaughter
reviewDescription: I have tried a number of times to order Kindle Unlimited, the first time when a couple of days ago when I purchased a Kindle for my granddaughter. It would have made sense to enable me to bundle the pair, but no, when I ordered, the subscription went to me. Not what I wanted. The last hour or so, I tried to order for the granddaughter in questions, scoured the customer service instruction and went up quite a few blind alleys. Frustrating/

My kindle stopped working, its not charging and I have only had it for 4 months. I tried getting helo trough chat and they did nothing. I also called them and the lady pretended she could not hear me. I am so disappointed.

Ultra lite, but as a Fire user and an old Kindle keyboard, I really dislike this. My old kindle, I could find my books easily....I read 100s , they were in order of when I bought. Now I am so frustrated and hate it. If my Fire wasn't so big, I would throw this away. Update, now this freezes and cannot read. Restarted multiple times. Really a piece of crap. Do Not Waste Money. Addendum, this piece of crap now says I have no library. Have had a kindle for over 12 years and bought thousands of books. Complete waste of sh.t. Not using at all. Keeps freezing and cannot turn pages

reviewTitle: Very difficult to get to the Kindle Bookstore.
reviewDescription: There is no easy way to get to the bookstore.  You can tap on the screen dozens of times before your 'Library' option appears, then you have to tap on the arrow to get to the Library, then you have to tap on the 'Home' option, then you have to tap on the little shopping cart to get to the Kindle book store. Even then, there have been occasions when the shopping cart does not show up. It is extremely frustrating.If you are reading a book that you don't really care for you have to scroll to the very end to be able to get to the Library option, then go through a dozen steps to get to the bookstore.When reading in bed, a bright light flashes when you try to turn the page.Why would Amazon try to change something that was easy to use and make it difficult?

reviewTitle: Updated: now it's back to Very Disappointing
reviewDescription: I had downgraded my disappointment, but now I'm more disappointed than ever, because it seems that either the kindle I received is malfunctioning and won't let me change the fonts of certain books, or there are just some books that don't allow you to change the font. As someone with both dyslexia and migraines, this is an absolute deal breaker. I just now gave myself a horrible headache after reading a few pages in this terrible font, and then I made it worse by spending too much time trying to fix the font with no success.Add that to the fact that the screen is too small and the entire thing is too lightweight to hold comfortable in your hand (I constantly feel like I'm going to drop it) this model of kindle is an incredible let down. The size of screen is important because if the font is too small it's hard to read and if it's too big I have to turn the page every 20 seconds given how fast I read. It's very annoying. Don't even get me started on having to scroll through my "library" of books covers with miniscule print that I can't read without clicking on it, and I will never stop being salty about the fact that basic kindles no longer have page turn buttons.

Not sure if it's specific to this version of the Kindle, but the battery in mine is faulty. I've read that this is a common problem with the device. I'm by no means an avid reader, but I bought the Kindle to encourage myself to read more. I've had it far less than a year, and use it pretty occasionally.All of a sudden, it will not charge when plugged in. Won't reset, is clean, and the charger and cable work fine with other devices.I'm really disappointed to have spend $100 on a simple device that didn't last me a year with very low use.

reviewTitle: Failed after gentle use for a month
reviewDescription: Kindle has been around for a while and I really thought it would be a solid choice for my teenage reader. But after giving it to him for Christmas and buying it on a black Friday deal, as soon as we were outside of the return window, it died and will not function. To make matter worse, I cannot reach anyone regarding a replacement, as we are outside the return window but with shopping black Friday deals for Christmas, this is not realistic and the time to failure was very disappointing. Hoping they will still replace and fix this for us but it has not been simple.

After all i heard about these i was excited to get one , boy i was i disappointed!!screen is very small about an inch shorter then my phone  a little wider but still really small.It's not very sensitive so you really have to tap the screen to turn the page .And you can't see achievements like I can on my phone.responses  very slow so when your scrolling looking for new books each page is slow to appearIt's way easier to find them using the app on my phone.I should have bought a regular tablet or kept using. My phone .The is the lowest  piece of crap they could of made.After this I'll never  buy any kindle again if they think this is acceptable.Buy a tablet or use your phone and don't waste your money.

UPDATE: I received a call from Amazon Customer Care less than 3 hours after my previous review! I was advised that they would be sending me a replacement and to please let them know if I had any further problems with my new Kindle.  I couldn’t be happier with the quick service by Amazon and how willing they were to correct the issue! Can’t wait to try my new Kindle!I was very excited to try the new small kindle. I’ve been using the Kindle app on my Apple Itouch for years due to enjoying the small screen size., so when this one came out I wanted to give it a try. It would allow me to read outside and would be a bit larger, but not too large. Setup was a breeze, but right away I noticed the screen would flicker on and off and had a delayed response. I decided to take it on vacation since I didn’t have time to get a new one before our trip. The problem continued and I was unable to connect to Wi-Fi or hotspot it to download books, very frustrating. I decided to return it for a new one, but was unable to figure out how to do it, it keep asking me to do tech support first and I didn’t feel it was necessary. I just want a replacement!! I ended up doing a return instead and I’m on the fence about ordering a new one since I got this one on sale! It will cost me $20 more to order it again. I was very disappointed in getting a lemon and not being able to replace it easily.

Very uncomfortable to hold - too large if compared to a large phone, too small for a comfortable e-reader.An attempt to connect to the public library account was a major headache, and getting books downloaded would have been a major quest (especially for Epub books, and that's what I was hoping to use it for).Light weight, yes, but you can just as well read on your phone screen, no need to have this.Very basic user options.And no charger included! For this price, and for such a simple device, it's a bit insulting.

I purchased my first Kindle in 2012, fell in love with it and have upgraded over the years.  When this particular model came out I had to have it!  It is a perfect size for slipping into my purse or the pocket of my down vest. Just ONE SMALL PROBLEM: while reading,  the screen suddenly goes grey, ads for recommended books appear, and in about a minute the screen will lighten with the Swipe to Open message appearing.  AMAZON sent a replacement.  Guess what?  Same problem.  I spent a great deal of time on both the telephone and on their chat trying to fix the problem.  The only resolution was to send both back and get a refund.

I was looking forward to this Kindle since I ordered it. But once I got it there have been nothing but problems. Won't sync to any device. Says this is my second kindle which is impossible since I've never owned one. It won't load and constantly says error or refresh. I paid for Kondle unlimited and that too is impossible to get into. Going to look into something else and see if I can just use this useless kindle for my kids.

reviewTitle: Either kindle is a bad product or I have been very unlucky
reviewDescription: I unpackaged this kindle, loaded my books onto it, used it rarely over the course of many months. I left it on my bedside table and charged it a few times. But after only using it a handful of times something went totally wrong with the screen. The complete screen is grainy and gray and I can barely see the content. After each page loads, the previous page is burnt into the screen still. I traded in a used kindle to get a discount on this one, but the whole reason that I traded that in is that the screen also had problems. I had carried it around in a padded backpack, but one day the screen had these big dents in it that the light would leak through making it impossible to look at. On top of that kindles just work extremely slowly, the touch interface feels like it’s a beta product from 10-15 years ago. I’m really sad because I thought kindle would be great for traveling and keeping many books at my bedside but overall it has continued to be a bad experience.

I’ve had this less than a week and I’m already returning it.1. It’s definitely on the small side. Much smaller than my phone!2. Slow to turn the page3. After a few days a “critical error” had occurred and I had to reset my entire kindle and lose everything.4. Very glitchy!5. Constantly freezes.I’m sorry but $99 is a lot of money to pay for a piece of junk!

What a flimsy piece of garbage. My son got this for Christmas, as well as a protective case which it has always been in.
