After only a couple months of use, it slips off his lap and falls less than 18in to the floor and the screen glitches out. Costs as much to replace the screen as it does to buy a new one.Very disappointing. My kids have dropped their iPad dozens of times, maybe hundreds of times, over the past 10 years and it still works great.
The backlight died after four months and I am having trouble getting support.

Aggravating!! Often jumps 2-3 pages per touch of the screen, no matter how light you tap. Can't tell you how many times I've missed the last page or two at the end of a book (can not go back a page or two once end is reached). Also tutorials are very lacking, as are appropriate Youtube videos. I cannot figure out half the things this unit can do. Much worse than my old Kindle that broke.

Would NOT sync with my Amazon account after 2 entire days trying.  Neither my I.T. literate son nor myself NOR Amazon's technicians could get it registered nor synced.  Returned. Very disappointed.  Good ustomer here.

reviewTitle: Bad Charging Port and Too Dim
reviewDescription: Just tried a couple of different USB-C cables with the Kindle 2022 model I got Oct 2023. The Kindle charging port doesn’t accept either cable- never did. Piece of crap! Also the light is too dim on the full setting- I won’t get another one of these ever and do not recommend it because of la knof quality.

I was very happy when I first received this updated device, as I only wanted something simple and small like my old Kindle that could no longer be used. However, I downloaded only 2 of my books onto it and within a day or two of using it, right in the middle of reading it started to reboot and then shut off. When I tried to turn it on again it was difficult to swipe and would only go to a blank screen. Amazon sent me this replacement and it has done the same thing with only one book downloaded in the middle of my first use. I didn’t see any one else reporting this error, but am upgrading to the next model as I can’t imagine it’s just a coincidence to have an identical defect in two devices that would would not result in a long term problem.

reviewTitle: I am unable to connect to Internet
reviewDescription: I am unable to connect to Internet with my Verizon mobile hotspot Jetpack

The wifi is constantly connecting then disconnecting. Research online shows that Amazon is aware of this issue, but doesn't feel like fixing it. Going back to regular books, never buying a kindle again.

reviewTitle: Doesn’t have a very long life span!
reviewDescription: Bought this Kindle 7 months ago and it just quit working!
This is the worst kindle we have owned. Have to restart it to get back to library. Can't find store. Once you finish a book can't get back to home page.

I bought this kindle on prime day in July, worked okay, a little different navigating compared to my voyage and old paper white, but was acceptable. But this morning I picked it up to read. When I opened my case, the ad screen was showing, but after swiping up my screen goes white, bright white!! I’m not sure what’s wrong with it, but it’s only a few months old and I’ve only used it a few times. Very upset! Hopefully I can get a replacement! I shared video and pictures to explain better.
Works well. It’s just that it gets scratches easily. Mine already have 3 scratches.

This is great for reading. I was trying to read books on the phone however even with the screen on dark mode it was difficult for me to read off of. I got the kindle and I was skeptical but it’s really like reading from a book. It doesn’t bother my eyes out give me a headache. It’s not that easy to use without looking at the manual like I thought. And I’m still not the best at it. The battery lasts a really long time and it’s really light weight

I got the 2022 Paperwhite at a really good deal, and it works well! The only problem is that mine had to have been refurbished or something because there's a book burned into the screen.  I can see it best when I'm reading in the daylight, "I'd like a bath", in large print, on the screen between the lines of  the book I'm currently reading.  It doesn't affect me too much, but it's just disappointing that I might have been sold a refurbished Kindle and it wasn't advertised as such.Otherwise, the battery life is absolutely incredible, I only have to charge it every other week, or once a week when I find a book I can't put down.

reviewTitle: Great but battery left greatly exaggerated
reviewDescription: Don't get me wrong I love this Kindle. I've devoured 2 books in a week but.....the battery life is exaggerated to say the least. When they were making the power estimates they obviously didn't take into account people who can read for hours on end. Even when the back light was on I kept it on low and it still only lasted me 6 days (far better than my phone but still).All other features are wonderful and I enjoy the distraction free reading I get from it. On my phone it's just too tempting to play the games on my phone or scroll on TikTok for a little too long.

Finally caved on a Kindle since most of the books I wanted to read are ebooks only. At first, it was a little glitchy when I would turn the pages, but it has gotten better, or I may have gotten used to it. The battery life is impressive. Mine is normally on airplane mode, except when I have to download books. The battery has lasted for nearly a week between charges with that. I do like it, it's great to travel with.

Overall product is nice and I love how light it is. However it doesn’t come with a charging block. Big disappointment, I don’t own a charging block compatible to the kindle for charging. Will have to make an additional purchase to charge it up to use it

reviewTitle: Kindle is great,  Still trying to cancel Kindle Unlimited
reviewDescription: Cancel Kindle Unlimited

This is a great little portable device. I bought it for the beach,  but haven't tried it there yet. My prior experience is just reading books on my tablet. Adds are only on lockup screen. Nothing pops up while you read. Don't pay for no adds. It's unnecessary.  I like this reader, but have to say, it's really tiny. Not much bigger than my phone. If you're using this as primary reader, you might not be happy, though you would probably get used to it. I like it's portability size. Easy to tuck in purse and not heavy. A selling point for this is the long battry life. I think it said weeks. Sorry... thats not true. If youre reading all day like I do, you'll only get a couple days from the battery. The only big concerns I have is that it doesn't seem to easily download books on its own. It seems much faster if I buy book on phone or tablet and just download by clicking when new book icon appears on the reader. Things I miss compared to my tablet is that you cannot choose a color when highlighting. I  use color highlights to mean different things. Other thing I miss is that, while it will look up words (dictionary), it doesn't have a translate option for foreign words. I really miss that function.All in all, it's a great device for the price.

Returning this because it's smaller than expected.  Great fit to carry in purse, but a little small to read.  Used to Apple products, so harder to adapt to Kindle product.  Don't like the Fire HD8 either.  But nice if you can get used to the other options....
Not the size of my original but does the trick - Loads many of my fav books and pdf's - easy to slip into a purse. Easy to charge. Easy to read. Easy on your pocketbook. What is there not to love....

Okay, as a huge reader I have been a skeptic of the e-readers. Mainly because I will always prefer an actual book in my hands to another piece of technology. The issue is that books I have been waiting for are only being released on a digital format, therefore I had to join the bandwagon. This little gadget is pretty amazing. First, it's so small and so lightweight - but the screen is so very easy to read. Second, I love the dark mode that can be selected for reading at night! No more booklight! This piece of technology is so crazy to me - and I absolutely love it. I did end up buying the fabric case for it because it is super slick and I was worried about dropping it. I will always be an "actual" book lover but this is a pretty handy item to have when your book hasn't been released in print. Third, I would definitely take this when traveling. I researched the e-readers along with mini tablets to see which would be the best fit and this is by far the winner for me. I highly recommend this.

reviewTitle: Get it and don’t look back!
reviewDescription: I absolutely love it! I thought I was a paper book person and wouldn’t enjoy a kindle but it’s the best thing I’ve ever bought!
My first Kindle was quite old, and it finally gave up :)This edition is a great replacement & value.
It’s the perfect size! There are so many great features about it too. I’ve really enjoyed reading from it.
This Kindle is much lighter than my previous version and the battery charge lasts quite a bit longer.

reviewTitle: This is my third Kindle and I love it.
reviewDescription: Love everything about this Kindle especially the size.  I can put it in my purse and it takes up very little space.
The quality is excellent and I particularly liked the size. The small size and long battery life make it perfect for travel.

reviewTitle: Loved Kindle 11th gen over Kindle PW 11th gen
reviewDescription: I honestly had a hard time deciding between this Kindle basic 11th gen and the Kindle Paperwhite 11th gen (PW). I own an older PW released in 2015 which I absolutely love but I wanted to finally try the Audible so I decided to upgrade. I tested both this Kindle Basic 11th gen and the Kindle PW 11th gen for about 2 weeks, used both everyday. I'm still a little on the fence but I finally settled with Kindle (basic) 11th gen because it met my basic needs.  Here are my observations which led me to pick the basic model.The first good thing about this basic Kindle is that the screen is more matte than the new PW. I could not get past the reflections that I see on the screen of the new PW when there is a window or light behind me when I'm reading. I do not have that problem with my old PW. I also prefer the lightness and the size of the Kindle basic, although the cheap feel of the plastic build bothered me at first. It slides more easily off my hand than the PW and it scratches easily but I fixed that by putting a back cover on the Kindle basic. The build of the new PW felt a lot sturdier though.I don't mind that the Kindle basic doesn't have the warm light feature that the new PW have although I'd probably use it when reading at night IF the basic had it. The warm light only works if you have the backlight on. I don't mind that the basic is not waterproof unlike the new PW. I don't soak in the tub and I rarely get in the pool to purposely read so I'm fine with it. I also like that the Kindle basic has an actual frame around the screen unlike the flushed screen on the new PW which makes me feel like I'm reading from a tablet, imagine the glare on top of that.Both of them get the slight screen burns when I scroll up or down, not too bad so far. Both of their bluetooth function (BT) worked great for Audible, but the BT coverage on the basic actually went just a few feet farther than the PW before it started cutting out. I did notice that the battery went down faster on the basic but it's probably because I left the BT "ON" all the time. I did get the "application error" message once on each reader at some point but it didn't seem to affect anything. Neither of them became glitchy although I'm not sure why I got the error message.They both worked good in dark mode. The glitch that other people mentioned when turning the page happened on both new PW and the basic. The dark mode lights up briefly (but quickly) before displaying the next page. This can be fixed by turning off the Page Refresh from the Reading Options menu.There are other features on new PW that I don't mind NOT having only because I could not get past the glare, size, heaviness, and the flushed frame of the PW. The Kindle basic met my basic needs without the cons, "my cons", of the PW :)  In my opinion, the Kindle basic is easier to carry because it's super lightweight, fits in my purse or pocket in my jacket easily, and I was able to adjust to the smaller screen size in no time. Overall, I think it would just really be a matter of preference between the two.Edited: I added 2 more pics to show the back cover with popsocket on my Kindle basic! :)
I use it to read our book Club choices.It is light weight and is easy to navigate.
Got this for my wife, she absolutely love it. She reads everynight for multiple hours. No complaints!

I really like this lightweight kindle & the fact that the color is on both back & front - I just wish that Amazon would put the on/off button on the TOP of the kindle so I didn't keep turning it off while trying to hold on to it. And WTF were they thinking when the changed the size of the charging port? I own 4 kindles and now 3 work off of the same mini charger, the same one as my phone, but this new one is a different size so I have to have its "special" charger with me or a second kindle in case the battery goes flat.UPDATE: It's now a frozen piece of Sh- plastic DO NOT BUY!!!!

reviewTitle: Where is my refund? It arrived Jan. 3 according to UPS back at Amazon shipping.
reviewDescription: Couldn't connect it, but when I solved that problem, decided that it was too small and wanted to trade it in. But it is taking Amazon forever to issue the refund, although the other thing in the same box was refunded. It arrived at Amazon Jan. 3, and this is Jan. 15. It should have been refunded by now. What is the problem?

What I can say about this ebook reader is that it was my mistake to have purchased it, and I regretted for having bought one. A device that has slow response to touches, no way to change the screen on/off to prolong its battery use (for each charge), the Help & User Guide (not sure preloaded into the device or resides somewhere in a China server) takes hours/ days (or months?) to load (because I got to exit as I could not wait); a book title is appeared in the Kindle store (from iPhone/ iPad) showed NO result in this device search for the same title in the Kindle store! I am not sure if mine is defective, but I should advise against getting this ebook reader. The uploaded picture here is the look of the device screen when I turned it off (why is it needed to be on forever while we are not looking at it! ! !).
it is smaller than I expected and I didn't realize I couldn't put any games on it.  I also don't like when I swipe to the next page, it flicks the background color which is very annoying.

reviewTitle: screen size is not  6" as described
reviewDescription: Picture shows screen is the same as my original kindle 4 7/8".  Why the deceptive detail.  I ordered mainly for the larger screen and ability to shut the light off, neither one is as described.

I’ve had this kindle for literally 1 year and a month. Haven’t read a book in a while so I needed to charge. Tried to charge and the green light comes on but the kindle won’t charge. Held the power button for 60 seconds and nothing. My previous kindle lasted for years. Completely disappointed in this product.

reviewTitle: didn't even last for one year
reviewDescription: This kindle didn't even last for one year.  It won't charge and there is nothing wrong with the charger.  What a rip off.  Looking for something else for a digital reader.

reviewTitle: POOR customer service while scamming customers for lockscreen ad removal nonsense!
reviewDescription: DO NOT PAY FOR LOCKSCREEN AD REMOVAL, ITS A SCAM!!After paying for the special lockscreen ad removal on top of already expensive PRIE membership, amazon customer service is a HUGE disappointment. After scamming customers for highly charged fee for all these add ons and services, they waster multiple days and my time to try and get the issue resolved. And i am still stuck in their vicious cycle of transferring the ticket to some 'specialist' department.You pay more to get better services, period! Now i am stuck with a faulty device which i was supposed to gift! HORRIBLE, MONEY EXTRACTING tactics from Amazon! Highly disappointed as a long time customer!

This is my 3rd kindle and highly disappointed. It’s small poor battery life.  I have had it less than a year and battery dies 2 hours into reading totally unacceptable. It’s fully charged I read for 2 hours and it dies.  It’s past the return period so now I am stuck with this paperweight because it’s worthless for reading since battery sucks. STAY AWAY UNLESS YOU ENJOY THROWING MONEY OUT THE WINDOW.
All seem good with this kindle but the battery drains too fast

I've only been using this for a week, and I've only charged the battery when I got it. What I don't like is the swiping. Left and right for the pages, down from the top for one menu and up from the bottom for another, but worse is the tap on the top for another menu.A bonus is the text to speech, First off, it doesn't freak out when jostled like the fire tablets. But it's blue tooth only, it has NO speakers. But was really sucks about it, it is hard, VERY hard to control. It takes patience and finesse to set it up into text-to-speech mode, and even more to get it back into regular reader mode, because of this, I will have to keep using the fire tablets for that option.August 1, 2023, update:Not even a month in and I've already had to charge it three times, once when I got it, a weekish and a half ago, and it's sitting on the charger right now. I'm only using it for about an average of an hour a day, (bedtime reading), and the light isn't full blast. I'm lucky if it makes it for 2 weeks let alone the 6 weeks they bragged about.The fourth star is starting to fade away....
Keeps turning off to screensaver while reading

My biggest issue is that it doesn’t have a scroll feature like on my phone app. Also if I make the font too big some of the text goes missing. Otherwise I like the weight and ease of slipping it in my purse even though I’ve misplaced it because it’s thinness allows it to slip between couch cushions easily.
Its broken

reviewTitle: Great Upgrade but could be a little smaller
reviewDescription: I love when Amazon continues to support their kindle e-ink devices. And with every new e-ink release, I always pick them up. They are such a niche product that doesn’t get enough credit. They are perfect devices that remind you to be more productive in life and help you disconnect and read!The Amazon kindle 2022 version comes with a USB C port and it is long overdue! Now I can finally pack away my micro usb cables for good! The device charges quickly and the battery life is great.The operating system is the same from previous devices but with some new quality of life improvements including a dark mode. I never knew I needed dark mode and I love it.I think the biggest critique I have for this kindle is the screen size. I wish that Amazon would release a smaller e-Ink device that’s the size of an iPhone. I love the idea of a smaller, more pocket sized kindle that can fit alongside my iPhone.I feel like Amazon is getting really close to an even better device and I hope they consider it. I truly think that a smaller e-ink screen the size of an iPhone would do great.Another suggestion I have for Amazon is to look at the PlayDate device. The playdate is an amazing device. Seriously amazing. I love how animated, and pretty the playdate is and how small it is too.Imagine if the next kindle functioned like a playdate and had more animated menus and sounds and book titles were more pretty. I think there’s so much possibility there.Anyway thanks for reading my review!

reviewTitle: Not my favorite Kindle and I don't like the sensitive touch screen
reviewDescription: I don't understand why the touch screen is so hyper-sensitive that it skips several pages and I have to go backwards to get to the page I needed to read.  I also don't like the yellow dark lighting, the blinding brightness of the screen when I try to purchase things on Kindle Store, or the battery drain unless I keep it attached constantly when on WiFi.  I was happier with my 2016 Kindle Paperwhite but Amazon doesn't seem to support it now and it balks when I attempt to transfer my previously purchased library books to it.  Upgrades are often not an improvement in my opinion when it comes to Kindles.  The BEST part of the newer version is how lightweight it is compared to my older model. I have added an extra star for that feature alone because it is a huge issue for me with the joint arthritis and fibromyalgia pain that makes holding any book or heavier Kindles nearly impossible.  I also need the ability to enlarge the print size as my eyes blur with anything other than daylight.  It's really more of a 3 stars for me, but for those that do not have my disabilities, it likely is worth purchasing and still beats most other readers by a mile.
I bought to read before bed and relax, I find it a little difficult to use , but I a, just learning how to use it. The light is good and the larger font is easy to read w no glasses.

reviewTitle: Great e-reader, but maybe not for big hands
reviewDescription: I finally bit the bullet and picked up a Kindle. My wife has had one for a few years and I realized that I should have one too. However, after using hers and making sure it would work for me, I realized that the newer models are smaller than previous ones. The screen is bigger, which is nice, but the overall unit is slightly smaller which just makes it a little harder to hold.  It's not a deal breaker but it's just something I didn't think would be an issue. Aside from that, I do like that brighter backlight. compared to my wife's (which is probably 4 yrs old) the backlight is so much brighter. For most uses, I actually have the backlight turned down to 40% because I don't need it that bright, but it's nice to have for certain situations. (Wife actually thought I bought a paperwhite because it's so much brighter.). Overall, highly recommend.

reviewTitle: Charging cord is a major problem.
reviewDescription: Amazon charged the power cord from the prior Kindle.  The transformer is the same, but the cord fitting is not.  It uses a micro B port (whatever that is).  I have bought multiple charging cables but have found only two which fit.  All the others do not work despite advertising for use with Kindle.My new Kindle uses a USB cable to a USB-C cable for the power supply.  I found this out only by going to a brick and mortar retailer.  My efforts at getting the correct cable from Amazon failed despite various tries.Amazon needs to verify a cable will fit the new Kindle before selling it.  The  Kindle itself is great but Amazon does not identify the power cord which is needed to charge this Kindle.My experience with getting a power cord which works ranks right up there with Ford selling Edsels.

reviewTitle: Great little device with excellent battery life.
reviewDescription: I use it mostly for reading during breaks and lunch at work. Small in size so fits well in the glove box of my car. forty minutes a day of use, five days a week and I charge it maybe once every three months. I paid to remove the ads after a couple months as it seems to take longer to wake up with ads enabled. Ad free appears to me to have cut the wake up time in half. If you use this a lot like I do, definitely worth paying the extra for the ad free version. Highly recommend!As a side note, the one I received does have one pixel on the screen near the middle that remains black at all times during use, but not when in sleep mode. Not a deal breaker, but I had to get used to it since it was  distracting at first.

Had to replace my old kindle after 10+ years of owning it. I had no trouble with the other one, but figured after 10 years it was a gonner. I read the reviews for this product and purchased it in March. In September, I did a reset to delete a lot of the kindle unlimited titles that were still showing up on the library even though I'd returned them. The kindle wouldn't reset. It just lights up the screen then does nothing until it shuts off again. I can't get it to start. Definitely not built like the earlier kindle models.
The product is ridiculously smaller than it's size as advertized.

I bought this Kindle and it didn't connect to the Kindle store. I updated, restarted, reset over and over and over... I had to exchange it for a new device. The same thing!!! The second Kindle could connect to Goodreads, but not to the Kindle store. I exchange it for a third one! Same thing!!! I have now spent three weekend trying to get this to work. I have been hours on the chat help desk and on the phone. I have given up... Get another device!

reviewTitle: Difficult to dl Library books, audio doesn’t work
reviewDescription: Following the directions for downloading audiobooks, I ran into nothing but trouble.Audio will either not play or be so broken up you can’t understand it.I had high hopes for this product and was left with a bad taste in my mouth. Returning it.
I used to have one of the original kindles and I loved it. This one is so hard to navigate. I can never get back to Home easily!

reviewTitle: BE CAUTIOUS. Mine didn't make it 8 months.
reviewDescription: Generally liked the readability and loved the battery life, BUT THE DEVICE DIDN'T EVEN LAST 8 MONTHS. Turned it on one afternoon to a blank screen. Cannot persuade it to show anything. Goes to blank screen and power light goes off within seconds of turning it on. Since warranted into Feb 24, am now struggling to find out how to contact Amazon for a replacement and having a heck of a time, so the best rating I can give overall is one star.
It is infuriating.  Some symbols, letters, numbers on the "keypad" do not work.  Absurdly slow.  Difficult to find books.  Don't waste your money on this one.

reviewTitle: Very upset with how Amazon is handling my issue
reviewDescription: They sent me a defective item that is burning when charging. I contacted them about the issue and they’re telling me I need to submit my government ID for a refund. This item is literally burning and smell sooo bad I told them I’m not touching the item to return as that is hazardous. Completely insensitive to their customers and expect me to put myself at risk to satisfy them.

reviewTitle: Buy with caution if you’re not 100% sure
reviewDescription: As an ‘old school’ lady, this is just not for me. I need a physical book with actual pages to turn.Tried returning it, but have to jump thru hoops - not like a std return.Very unhappy right now.

reviewTitle: Can not get this new Kindle to sync with my old Kindle
reviewDescription: I am now on my fifth try of trying to sync this new Kindle through my iPhone.  No matter what I do, it will not sync.I need to send it ba ck for a full refund

I switched from a Fire to this annoying Kindle and couldn’t be more disappointed. Not a fan of the gray and white theme but I can even get past that if the light was brighter and the pages didn’t freeze. When it happens I have to go to home and download again and it happens frequently. It operation is not smooth at all and becomes frustrating when I try to navigate through it. I was going to upgrade to the Oasis but after reading through the reviews, I believe I am going back to the Fire tablet. They are easy to look at and easy to use and most importantly they work!

This is the second Kindle that I’ve had (this one less than 3 months) where the home screen locks up after one of the many ‘software updates’ and no amount of troubleshooting or attempts to reset resolves the issue.Amazon customer service is helpful but it would be better if the product was reliable and didn’t require warranty.Buyer beware.  There are numerous reviews all saying the same thing.

reviewTitle: This is useless. I'm stuck on one
reviewDescription: This is useless.  I'm stuck on one page and can't get out, total wate of money. Can't return because I have my information.

Had this about a year and it's starting to skip pages an go backwards. Also spontaneously shows rating page in the middle of a sentence. Can't say I'm surprised as very little has lasting quality these days. Disappointed.

reviewTitle: Do not order it. Awful flimsy, poorly made item!
reviewDescription: Do not order this. It doesn't work. It is a flimsy poorly made item. The screen is not sharp. It is slow to flip from page to page. It takes forever to load. It doesn't charge fast or last long once you charge it. It doesn't properly connect to Wi-Fi or sync to your account. The image quality is awful and blurry. I would NOT recommend it. It also took over a month for Amazon to ship. Their service is awful. Outsourced! I had to talk to them 30 times to get help. Nobody knew anything or could help.

reviewTitle: Can no longer charge my Kindle.
reviewDescription: I can no longer plug in the charger. Something happened to the plug in port. How do I replace this?

So disappointed to find portion of my screen frozen. I’ve only had this for about 2 weeks and this happened. It was working perfectly fine a couple hours before I found it like this. Did not drop it/hit it or anything. Tried restarts/ charging it and it made the screen look worse.

I pretty much hate this device. I thought it would be nice for all in the sun which it is. I do not like that it’s in black-and-white because I have magazines on it but the worst thing is it’s very hard to get back to the library when you’re on a page, hard to manipulate and I am barely used it and there’s a crack I would like to know who I can get help with this product it’s been in that case I opened it up it was setting up and somehow It is cracked
I didn't realize this would be so small.  I was never able to finish my registration on this.  Returned and ordered Kindle Fire 10, which I absolutely love.
Slips out of the hand to land on the floor no problem. Black and white only???

My 2019 kindle was starting to slow down, so I traded it in for this newer / upgraded edition. I’m annoyed to report there is not a single thing on this newer kindle that isn’t a *downgrade*1. It’s slower.Anytime I try to highlight or note, the screen freezes and takes several seconds to react. All in all it takes 30-60 seconds to even type out a note (ya the keyboard freezes too) to get in a highlighted note that should / usually takes 5 seconds. It’s annoying.2. Inconsistent WiFiNot only has it not automatically connected to my home Wi-Fi ( I need to go into the settings every time I wake the thing up to read which ALSO freezes it) when I do select the connection from the scan, which is full strength, the kindle fails to connect saying it’s an internet issue (which it’s not. Other devices connected fine)I tried other networks. Failed.Tried after a restart as the screen instructed. Failed.It’s not the end of the world I’m sure I can return / get a replacement, but as a heavy reader… I’m *so* annoyed.0 stars. I should have tried the paper white. I didn’t at first because I loved my original kindle and didn’t want the bigger screen (more expensive but not too much). #regrets

reviewTitle: The most disappointing purchase I've ever made...
reviewDescription: The screen was so terrible. I really wish a took a picture before I sent it back. It was straight from a crappy arcade prize. It was so hard to see the screen and it would take FOREVER to scroll down. This would have been great if it came out in 2002. The quality on this device is just sad.  I can't believe they would charge $100 dollars for this.

reviewTitle: The battery doesn’t hold a charge
reviewDescription: I just got this kindle Nov 2023, from the start I had problems with it not letting me turn the page cutting the book off. I called customer service and they helped me troubleshoot.  After the final return date has passed I now have battery issues (doesn’t hold a charge…last only 3 hours).  I’m so upset!  I’ve bought quite a few kindles and have gifted a lot…but I got to say this new kindle SUCKS! I refuse to buy another one.

reviewTitle: This is the worst kindle I’ve ever had.
reviewDescription: My husband got me this kindle for my birthday this is the 3rd kindle I’ve had in my life time. I’m so beyond disappointed. I’ll start with positives because it’s a shorter list, it’s light weight, the swiping features/dark mode are nice, and just like that we have concluded the positives. I wish it had more length because when you go to turn the pages I seem to be always toggling the settings a lot more than actually turning the page. I had one of the very first kindles with keyboards and even back then the whole point of a kindle was that it dimmed and brightened to fit your environment without disrupting your reading experience. The page refresh and how you can see words on the previous page and options you’ve selected is atrocious (other commenters are calling it screen burn) if you read fan fiction on your kindle this is not the kindle for you the screen burn/refresh issue makes it a jumbled mess of the pages and you cant read anything. I can’t believe Amazon has put a product out like this. I will be returning this and getting a real kindle because this isn’t one. I don’t normally review items but i needed the community to understand how awful this product is if you’re expecting a real kindle. I will say that if all you do is read real books it’s not too bad, it doesn’t do the sunscreen burn in them. Not dimming automatically is a huge deal breaker for me I’ve discovered. Hope this was helpful. Happy reading.

reviewTitle: This is a very frustrating product without adequate instructions
reviewDescription: I loved my old Kindle from a dozen years ago. This one is lighter and prettier but VERY CLUTTERED with crap (even though i paid for no ads). It doesn't show clearly which books I haven't read yet, nor has it removed from the device the books I removed from the old one. There's no easy way to navigate it and since it lacks an instruction manual, all Amazon does is throw me from one previous question by someone else, that doesn't address my issue, to another. I'll have to resort to writing down on paper which books I've paid for and still haven't read. Isn't that medieval?

reviewTitle: Lied to multiple times by AMazon Custyomer Service about a Warranty replacement
reviewDescription: My Kindle stopped charging, and I called to resolve the issue.  No resolution was possible, so I was told a replacement would be shipped.  I called a month later when it didn't arrive, and was told that it was being held by the shipper and would be delivered in a few days.  It never arrived.I called again and was told that there was no record of a replacement, and that I would have to provide not only my original payment method but a backup payment method to restart the whole process again.  The same service agent tried to tell me that I needed a copy of my warranty card, which is just rank BS.So, I was lied to twice and shown very clearly that I am not a trusted customer, despite being a prime member (no longer) who orders $100's of dollars of items monthly (not any more).  See you in arbitration,, Amazon

reviewTitle: Stopped working after only a year
reviewDescription: We moved recently so the Kindle had not been charged for a while. I go to get it out and the screen is frozen on a low battery screen, will not charge, or do anything else. I contacted customer support and since it’s one month past the warranty, they had no solution except offer 15% off a new product. So if you have this, don’t let it go uncharged or it will stop working.

reviewTitle: How to register the damn thing!!
reviewDescription: I got my sister a new Kindle yesterday. We have been ripping our hair out trying to get it registered so she can use it. Why do you make it so difficult to register the Kindle.  I DON'T REMEMBER HAVING TROUBLE WITH MY LAST TWO KINDLES. THIS IS CRAZY MAKING!!!

This is the most Un-user friendly device I have ever owned.  Extremely challenging to find the correct tapping spot to get to the store/Home Screen/library.  Once you do get to the store, you only see 4 or 5 categories to select (books you may like in kindle unlimited, based on your reading, best sellers in kindle unlimited, Amazon charts most read).  Once you select one of those recommendations; there’s limited books listed!  Depending on what you select; you may only see 20 books to choose from.  How do you find the thousands of books that should be accessible to read?  You have to type the name of the book or author in the search box.  So for those of you who like to browse through kindle bookstore to find your next read…this kindle is not for you! Guess I will browse my kindle fire and when I find a book I want to read, I can send it to this kindle to read, because that is all you can do with it.  The only positive is it is lightweight.  Very disappointing.

Worked great and I loved it… until it decided to die after only having it for little over a year.  Highly disappointed!! If you buy I’d recommend paying for the extended warranty, otherwise you’re screwed if anything happens to it after 90 days!  Lousy warranty policy!!

I didn’t know they had a Kindle app. I’d probably consider downloading that before you decide to buy kindle I would say if you’re trying to stay off of phones get one, but I prefer the app because I can just see the covers better. I have a slight problem, where occasionally I cannot turn to the next page it registers the book as Me having gotten to the end when I’m at the beginning or the middle overall download the app
A little small, but overall good product
Oops, my bad, not what I wanted, need Fire

Great profile for traveling.  Touch screen is a bit sensitive, though it may just be unrealistic expectations after using an iPad.  My biggest gripe is the inability to download and read library books from Cloud Library.  I very much liked my Kindle Note, and have a reasonable collection of books, but a I don't feel it fair to be harnessed to the proprietary software which limits use.

This would be perfect IF there was real contrast between the "black" and "white" - the black is really grey, and the white is never white.  So when you put it in dark mode, you strain to see the white, because it's basically a light grey.  It hurt my eyes to look at it.  If this is what the $100 price point gets you, I'll just keep using paper, or a tablet app.

reviewTitle: DOES NOT SUPPORT IMMERSION READING IN 2023
reviewDescription: Despite some other reviews saying this device supports immersion reading, it does not. You can listen to audio books and you can read books, but not at the same time. I’m surprised that a device released in 2022 can’t handle what I would assume is easy multitasking for any device released after 2010. Other than this gripe it’s a nice little device.

reviewTitle: Can't order the next book in a series where offered after the last page of the book I just read.
reviewDescription: I'm annoyed because for the first five or six books (in a series) I was redirected to go to the AMAZON sign-in page, which asked for a password. The slot provided was so small I couldn't read my password when I ent4red it, and I didn't think I should have to anyway!  It took  me several tries to realize I had to go into my library and seek the title then order it there. Why have the feature to let the reader click on the Go to next book feature if it can't be used? Also...the case is so slippery I drop the book frequently while reading it. I miss my larger version (which was only 1/2 and inch larger, but just better. )

reviewTitle: Nothing to alert you backlight is on
reviewDescription: Love the new size, weight and capacity, however.... there really should be some sort of visual cue that the backlight is on in case you forget, so you don't drain battery in daytime.  Also, expanded capacity, but OS complains when you exceed number of files past that of old models capacity ? Update with software fixes needed.

reviewTitle: Not as good as Kindle Paper White
reviewDescription: Sorry I didn't stick with a Kindle Paper White.  This is harder to see the pages and to order new books off my wish list.  Doesn't seem to work correctly.  But, I tried to save a few bucks so I'm stuck with it for awhile.
Screen quality and responsiveness right out of 1997.  Sent it back.  I see no compelling reason to use this over just running the kindle app on a phone or iPad or other tablet.  Should be $30.

reviewTitle: Decent for reading, but cannot listen to audiobook simultaneously.
reviewDescription: This kindle (just as all other e-ink based kindles) does not allow you to follow along reading the text while you listen to the audiobook. It only lets you to oick either read or listen, not at the same time. I mean, that's just very bad design. It's like a car whose steering wheel only turns if the car stops moving. Wtf?

reviewTitle: Missing many features available in the phone app.
reviewDescription: This is my 3rd Kindle, beginning with the original. I was expecting a top quality user experience, which is not what I get with this 2022 model.PROS:1. Love the 6” size. Super lightweight, ultra thin, portable & comfortable to hold for long periods of time.2. Good options to format the font, text size, spacing & margins to your personal preference.3. Fantastic storage. I cant imagine ever running out.4. Reasonable price.5. Three free months of Kindle Unlimited6. Books with Audible option at no additional charge.7. Bluetooth lets me use my headphones.8. Displays Battery % and Clock which I loveCONS:1. The scrolling is not smooth at all. It is jumpy & difficult to control via the vertical slide bar on the touch screen. I find it very frustrating.2. When searching the Store for a new book, there is no option to filter by Category. This is a huge HUGE problem. There are 62,000+ books in the Store list of Kindle Unlimited “ Books” with 4stars and above, with very limited filter/sorting options. Amazon Audible allows user to filter by Category AND Sub-Category. Kindle should have this same feature, baked in. Needs to be fixed asap.3. Option to display Page #, but no option to display Page # of total # of pages.  I have no idea how many pages are in the book or left.4. The Kindle Audible Speed option is 1.0 then the only next option is 0.75. This is way too slow.  There is no way to set Speed at 0.9 as I can with Audible, or customize with a slide. Some Audible narrators speak too rapidly for the experience to be enjoyable. But being forced to slow down by 25% is ridiculous, imo. At the very least, there needs to be a series of incremental declines of 0.15.  The Page turn on this Kindle requires a very firm tap on the touch screen. I feel like I have to rap the screen to turn a page. I do not see an option for Smooth Scrolling rather than this firm tap/rap to advance the page.6. Navigation within Settings relies heavily on a series of Back Arrows. Awkward. Too many “clicks”The last time I purchased a new Kindle was 2016. I was expecting a superior upgrade in functionality & user experience with this 2022 model. Very disappointed. The Kindle should have all the features available in the phone apps., imo

reviewTitle: Adequate, but less flexible than previous verions
reviewDescription: Disclaimer: I have had a version of every kindle since they were first marketed, until now.I have not used the current Paperwhite, Oasis, or Scribe.Pros:This machine is light, easy to operate (except for the on/off button at the base were it can be pressed inadvertently, depending on how one holds the kindle).The resolution is good (just not as good as the Voyage or previous Paperwhite).It' very easy to increase the backlight or change the font.The large amount storage is Very Nice.Cons:The kindle (well all my kindles have done this) will restart or update software randomly. It would be preferable it this could happen when one is Not reading.The software is much less flexible. (Caveat, it's possible my previous kindles are now older than 4 years and so have not been updated - for which I am grateful, if that's the case. I have not purchased the current paperwhite.)The search and sorting functions are less flexible. While sorting by publication date, author, or title is still possible. However, once sorted by author or title, instead of keying in the start of a title or author's name guess where on the slidebar your author or title is located and touch that spot.... and then got swipe up or down to go back or advance.You can't get rid of the book cover - while nice, it takes up space and so you can see at most four titles on a screen in list view.All that aside, if I hadn't been spoiled by the earlier models, I would be quite happy with this one.

I've owned the Kindle for over a month and have read several books on it.  For what it's designed to do, it does pretty well.  I knocked off a star because I find navigation on the Kindle to be somewhat awkward.  A 2nd star was deducted because of the ads for which you have to pay an extra $20 to eliminate.  Nearly all the ads were for children's books, despite the fact I had  none of these types of books in my Kindle's library.  I ended up paying the extra $20 just so I didn't have to look at the annoying cartoon-ish ads.

reviewTitle: Hmmm ... Slow response time, white screen flashes constantly, can't download Libby app
reviewDescription: Well, I had high hopes for this, but after running into roadblock after roadblock trying to download the Libby app and to get help with that issue, plus the slow response time for various commands, to the flashing white screen in between each command - I'm not sure this is a great device.Yes, it's lightweight. Yes, I can adjust the font size and layout. But I really wanted to use it for borrowing ebooks from the local library (which uses Libby) and without the ability to even download that app, well, its usefulness to me approaches 0 ... Also the font size on the screens for requesting help with the Libby app problem is *maybe* 1 pt. type, requiring a magnifying glass to even navigate, and then there's the delay in between each letter that one must type using the virtual keyboard, only to finally be told there's a "captcha" issue and the request for help is then dead in the water. Yes, I'm connected to my wifi. I will ask the library staff if they know how to help, but that's really not their job.And the delay when typing letters using the virtual keyboard is truly maddening. The flashing white screen that shows up all. the. time. when trying to use commands is annoying. I may give this to my mother and see if she can master the navigation just to read books I can download from Amazon, but as the navigation is also somewhat confusing, I'm not sure that will work.Really disappointed. If they're going to add a web interface for downloading apps like Libby, and advertise that it can do that, then it should work. If they're going to have a virtual keyboard, it shouldn't have such delayed response time. And the flashing white screens are making me nervous that the planned obsolescence for this thing is intended to be weeks or months. I will probably look at a tablet for myself, maybe the iPad Air. Pretty much overkill for an eReader, but there you go.

reviewTitle: My least favorite Kindle I've had
reviewDescription: I've had 6 or 7 of these most basic model Kindles since I bought my first one in 2012. They do exactly what I want them to do, which is store hundreds of books, provide a no-glare screen with reasonable battery life at a reasonable cost, and I've been very happy with all of the devices I've had in the past. I read for at least 3-4 hours every day, so I'm rather hard on them. The main reason I've had to replace a device in the past is that the battery will no longer hold a charge. My first device from 2012 lasted for 6 years, while all the other ones last 2-3 depending on how often I use them. I usually have 2 devices I go back and forth between at any once time.That was the issue with my Kindle before this one, so I was pleased to be able to sell the device back to Amazon for a $20 gift certificate that I put toward the price of my new Kindle, plus a 20% discount on my next device, so it was almost half off. That being said, when I got my first 2022 release model, I discovered it had more issues than any of the other models I've had in the past. My main complaints are the slow speed of the built-in keyboard compared to past models, and the fact that my particular device puts itself into sleep mode at least a few times every day. It does this both when I have just touched the screen a few seconds past, or if I touched it a minute ago. I also noticed that compared to past models, there is a lot more finicky having to opt-out of all the features I don't want turned on for privacy, etc. The only thing I like about this edition of the basic Kindle more than past versions is that it is offered in blue, which makes a nice change from basic black.

I’ve owned several kindles since they have come out and they have always lasted years. One even lasting after a quick dip in the tub! I bought this in July of ‘23 & have only had to charge 2 or 3 times and now it won’t charge at all. I am very disappointed.Edit: I read through a lot of reviews and decided to try leaving it on the charger for a day. I left it on for hours at a time before with no result but this time it worked!I find it quite strange that it takes that long to register any charge but I am quite happy that it is working so I added one more star.
Love this product but my backlight no longer works so no night reading. I’ve had it for 3 months :/

reviewTitle: It’s a lil big for the small reader.
reviewDescription: It’s is sturdy. But, my reader keeps slipping out out the slots.

I like this Kindle, but it has a few problems:1. It rarely turns one page at a time. It started out turning two pages ahead, then five, and now it goes backwards just as often as it goes forward, so I get pulled out of my story and have to go hunting for the last place I read with almost every page turn. It would be comical if it wasn't so frustrating, especially when I'm trying to read myself to sleep at night.2. Turning the page sometimes triggers a bright white flash, even in dark mode. It can be extremely painful when reading at night.3. It doesn't communicate well with other readers on my Kindle account. My old Paperwhite knows exactly where I left off on the new device, but the new device hasn't a clue that the old device exists. This is very frustrating when re-reading books because the new device will try to send me to the very end of the book, thinking I'm done with it. And don't get me started with trying to sync on the mobile app. I've stopped using that altogether.4. I can't find a cover that stays open while holding the Kindle at an angle, such as when laying down to read. If my grip loosens at all, the Kindle side flops down, pulls the whole cover out of my hand, and hits me in the face.5. The battery lasts about half as long as my original Kindle, so I'm frequently interrupted to recharge the device.Other than those admittedly huge issues, I still love the concept of Kindle. That said, I do hope Amazon will see this review and fix as many of these issues as they can in a software update.

Really does help me want to read more for some reason. Probably cause it feels as easy as scrolling on a phone but for books. Just wish it had a warm light to back light when dark instead of the white.
returning
Not what expected
Don't get me wrong, I love owning this device. I was disappointed in the size and also that it was only a b&w display. Other than that, it's great!
No instructions on how to get to the library or how to change the font.  Have use trial and error.  Still haven't found ok me stuff.
I bought a kindle  several several years ago and it had gotten so slow . so I bought the newer updated one. It is not any faster so I’m very disappointed. Other than that I like it.

I got this because of the price and because of the ability to trade in Kindle that was not usable I found from a yard sale.  Things I like are the ability to get books from overdrive/libby but I wish it was easier to do on the kindle itself rather than on the computer.  I also like the fact that the Kobo has a pages left till the end of the chapter and I wish that the Kindle did the same.  Maybe when they update the software they can add the pages left feature.  The size is similar to my Kobo Touch but the Kindle is incredibly light weight and I feel like I'm going to break it.  The screen is pretty crisp and easy to read and it fits in my back pocket of my jeans.

reviewTitle: Still Can't Remove Book Covers From Home
reviewDescription: The Kindle is easy to read in sunlight which I like. The controls are less responsive than with a higher end product but are adequate for the price. I expected to get the same level of controls that I get with the Kindle app and that isn't what is on the device. Compared to the Kindle app options, this Kindle 11 Gen is pretty basic.Also, I get that Amazon wants to keep the Kindle 11th Gen as simple as possible for the price yet would it be that difficult to allow the user to remove the covers from books from the Home shelf? The covers are moved when a Kindle Unlimited book is returned, but when I remove the download for a book I purchased, the cover remains and messes up seeing what books are unread on the home shelf. I know that one can use the library to determine what is and isn't read. That isn't the point, the main page takes me to the Home shelf and that should be able to be cleared of covers of books that have been read. Amazon hasn't felt compelled yet to fix this problem since I've read so many other reviews remarking on this. I'm adding my voice to the complaints.

Hello. Not so long ago I purchased my new Kindle 11th Gen and I found out something that really bothering me. It is about the Kindle's UI. When I go to my Library and when I want to change my View options I have to think a lot to find the right thing to do.Also in the head of the Library page there are lot of free space which is never used and that hit my eyes. Page just look empty and as user you don’t really understand the View options are actually On and whether other options are there.If it's possible, please change that thing. Can you move View options menu to the top as I made on the concept pic? In my opinion it looks way better and you always understand which option is turned On. Also when you are in Collections mode the «+» sign seems to be more clear why is it there.

reviewTitle: Battery life is not what is advertised.
reviewDescription: I love the size and the weight of this kindle. Don’t get “weeks of use” with the battery life though. I get 2-3 days worth of use out of a single charge which isn’t bad, it’s just not what is advertised. Overall I like it, don’t have many complaints.
This item is giving me an amazing experience. I hesitated at the beginning, but I just ate 2 books in 1 week, I think is one of the best investments of the year!

I love my Kindle and use it all the time. I was so hesitant to get one because I enjoy reading paperbacks so much but this is so much easier to hold on to than a big novel. Also easy to slip into the purse so you have your book wherever you go!

reviewTitle: Obsessed, it goes everywhere with me!
reviewDescription: Sooooo glad I got a kindle. I've read 6 books already and I've only had it for two weeks. I was using my iPad before and it was way too big and clunky.I went back and forth on this model and the paperwhite and chose this one mostly for the compact size. It's perfect!! The paperwhite would have been too big to take around in my tiny purse and too heavy for long reading sessions. I also like the non-flush screen. It's like a real reading experience.
I wear them out usually, although I’ve lost one and broken one.And it’s the best. The small size, the light weight. Feels so good in the hand and the screen looks so good.

My husband loves reading his books now on the Kindle.  We had planned an extended vacation but didn’t want to carry a lot of books.  He was surprised at how long the kindle charge lasted and how new books downloaded in an instant.

reviewTitle: Is this really all you need
reviewDescription: With over 7000 reviews of this model if you find mine it may not be what you expect. I find that most reviews of this line of readers almost always come from avid users of the brand who either are excited about certain improvements or angry that it's not what it used to be. I actually had one of those original ones with the keyboard and it was dead for a long time. I had a new battery put in, knowing that I could have bought a brand new one for the same price, and it was still dead. I think eventually the e-ink simply gives up and can't make an image. It's shame because those were pretty nice units. Before I bought this one on sale on Prime Day I read an excellent article about e-readers as a category, not just Kindles, and learned some solid truths that weren't written by a press agent. Once this model was introduced the more expensive ones really don't buy you much more in dollar value and some of the so called features can really work against you. There's no escaping it - to be able to just grab your Kindle anywhere at any time this model is all you need and easily the most convenient. The quirks? Sure we all know about them and after all these years and with all of the advances in technology they are massively overpriced and under engineered. But it is a continuous profit stream for them so why mess with it? At the sixty-four bucks I got this for it is only about three times overpriced, they should be going for no more than twenty five bucks and the accessories are through the roof as well. But if you really want to tote a couple of hundred books around with you and have them fit in your pocket, there is still nothing better than this basic model.YES NO MAYBEFor the closing argument I gathered the three most often cited complaints, or negatives, about the basic Kindle and being an owner here's my opinion on them. No waterproofing (oh really, and just how many paper books have you read in the swimming pool?)  No color temperature adjustment (same question, when was the last time you read a paper book and changed the color of the page from white to orange?) And finally, raised bezel design (no really, this is among the top three complaints, I can't even come up with a comeback for that one, Virtually every TV and computer monitor screen has a bezel, why did it get to be a problem if your Kindle has one?Stop reading other people's opinions and buy one and go sit under a tree and read an interesting book.

reviewTitle: Amazon proves why they are the king of e-readers
reviewDescription: What is great about this?It shows Amazon's commitment to these devices.The screen is great. It looks like you are reading a paperback book.the backlight is great and not too bright. It kicks on when the room is dark, and adjusts accordingly.The touch screen is responsive and updates fast.It's small as well (fits in my pocket.)With a magnetic case, the auto-wake feature works like a charm.These are great if you like to read your books on a digital screen due to the nature of e-ink, you won't suffer from eye fatigue like you would reading a book on a phone screen.The cost is great as well. You simply cannot beat this e-reader at this price point.

I have started reading a ton recently, and I love the feel of a physical book. However, it gets to be expensive buying books at the rate that I read them. In the past three weeks I’ve read eight books on my Kindle app on my phone and I’ve bought several physical books. Once I realized how fast I was reading, I knew that I needed to get a e-reader to help avoid eye strain and save me money on physical books.I got the refurbished Kindle and it is literally like new. I see absolutely no issues with it and I regret nothing

I was hesitant to buy a kindle.  I thought i would miss ohysically holding a book.  I gave in and now I'm hooked!  It's so convienient to have multiple books at your fingertips.  It easily fits in my puse so it is always with me.  I can read anytime, even at 4 AM when I can't sleep!
This is a great Kindle to carry along in my purse.  I look forward to it's longer battery life.  It would help if the appropriate cover(s) were shown along with it.
